La is 39 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating agricultural crops and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $8 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. All of her children are still in her care and in school.

 In order to improve her business, La is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is an industrious woman who untiringly helps her husband maintain the farming business they have. She and her spouse have been planting and harvesting rice to sell for over 10 years now. Gina has three children. The youngest still attends school. They provide sustenance for the family through their income from the business. 

Gina is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy insecticides and pay for labor costs in farming. She hopes to continue producing a good harvest so she can earn more profits to use for paying school fees and can save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and pay for labor costs in farming.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is a rice grower at Liwan Sur. He had been doing it for 20 years as his business. Luis is now 52 years old, married and has two grown-up children. Through his income from the farming business, he has been able to sustain their education needs. 

Luis is now asking for a loan of P50,000 to maintain his farming business. He has insufficient funds now because his income from the last harvest went for paying additional laborers who helped him plow the field, plant and harvest rice to sell. From his loan, he will buy to buy seeds to grow, fertilizers and insecticides to maintain healthy crops to harvest. 

Someday, though he has experienced a lot in his business, he still aims to improve his farming practices for better crop production, thus meeting his goal for his family's economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Willie

texts.en:
Willie is 54 years old, a married man who lives at Nabbotuan with his loving wife and three children. One is currently attending college to earn a degree. 

Willie is a farmer  who plants and harvests rice to sell. His wife also helps him in the rice field. They have been in the farming business for 30 years now. He has a stable income and would like to increase it because nowadays, matriculation fees are getting expensive, too. 

For this reason,  he joined ASKI and is borrowing a loan of P20,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, insecticides). This will help increase crop production, thus boosting his profits, too. Willie will be very happy and proud to see all his children having better employment and successful in life someday.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, insecticides) used in farming

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 20 years old, single and lives with his parents in the town of Lanna. His father is a farmer and has taught him a lot about the business of farming. For the last two years, Joel has earned a living by growing rice, and makes about PHP 30,000 for each of the two harvests he has each year. He uses his income to pay for electricity, food and other basic items. He would like to improve his farming practices and ensure good crops, and is requesting a loan for PHP 43,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicide. His goal for the future is to have plentiful harvests that will allow him to save for an emergency.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for use on his farm.

loans.name: Claridel

texts.en: Claridel is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products to the local community. She has done this for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Claridel is asking a loan of PHP 47,000 to  help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claridel is a very responsible person in terms in managing the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, beverages and spices

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar, 46, is married and lives with his three children and his wife, who are his main priority. With this loan he plans to buy supplies for his rice crops. He has some empty land that has nothing planted on it, and so he will plant rice there to use the land and derive benefit from it. He wants to plant his crops under good conditions so that he can take maximum advantage of the land. 

Jomar is requesting a loan of P 40,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pay some other farm expenses. His goal is to obtain the earnings he needs to get ahead and provide for the well-being of his family. He also wants to save to provide for his family's security in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and pay some other farm expenses.

loans.name: Vichear

texts.en: Vichear is 19 years old. He is single and resides with his parents in Banteay Mean Chey Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. Due to the difficulty in his family’s transportation, Vichear is requesting a loan of $550 to purchase a motorbike to use to commute to work. This purchase will help him get to work on time. In the future, he would like to be a construction foreman and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe lives in the town of Annafatan with his wife Virginia and their four children. He is 48 years old and has made a living as a farmer for more than 20 years. He had not been able to secure a better job because his education ended after high school.  Once he graduated, he began planting and harvesting corn for sale. He would like to improve his cornfield, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. He hopes to grow a healthier and larger crop and earn enough money to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
On is 30 years old. He is married and resides with three children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years. In addition, he is a teacher. He earns approximately $5 each day. His wife runs the business of purchasing junk and materials to resell. She earns about $7 daily. 

Due to the difficulty in his family’s transportation, On is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will enable him to use the saved money on his transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Jevelyn

texts.en:
Jevelyn, aged 38, is borrowing PHP 25,000 from ASKI as additional working capital in her buy and sell business. She would use to purchase fish. This is a great assistance in providing a better quality of fish in their village, in improving her business and their living condition as well. 

Jevelyn has had three years in this business and feels that she has healthier living. She is aspiring for more, a better way of living, good education for her children and a good future. Hopefully, with the unending hard work and strong determination, she can achieve the goals to which she aspires.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: William Hernan

texts.es:
William es un emprendedor que con 21 años decidió montar su propia tienda general para sostener sus propios gastos y además de esto la empezó cuando se enteró que su esposa se encontraba embarazada, así que gracias a su negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo de 14 meses de nacido. Hace 2 años comenzó con su tienda y esto le ha permitido tener una buena calidad de vida en su hogar, además de buenas oportunidades económicas para progresar; pero lo más importante es que William se ha ganado el reconocimiento de las personas por el gran carisma que lo caracteriza y la buena atención que ofrece en su tienda. Debido a que sus ventas vienen aumentando considerablemente, William busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y así podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas. Su sueño es poder comprar su casa propia y darle a su familia un hogar estable, y en un futuro comprar el local donde tiene ubicada su tienda.
texts.en:
William, 21,  is a small businessman who decided to set up his own general store to cover his expenses.  Also, he started the business when he found out that his wife was pregnant, and thanks to this business has managed to provide for his 14 month-old baby.  He started the business 2 years ago, and it has allowed him to have a good quality of life in his household and has given him good economic opportunities for progress.  But what is most important is that William has gained the recognition of people for his great charisma and the good service that he offers in his store.  As a result, his sales have increased considerably.  William is seeking a loan to buy consumer staples so that he can offer a greater variety of products for his customers.

In this way, he will be able to have more income for his household and will have a better quality of life and better economic opportunities.  His dream is to buy his own house and provide his family with a stable home.  In the future, he wants to buy a place where he can relocate his store.

loans.use: to buy products that are consumer staples, so that he can offer a greater variety of products to his customers

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha is 48 years old, married and the mother of one child who lives with her family in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. For more than six years, she has earned a living by working with her husband to sell utensils and run a game in an amusement park. She earns about $7 a day and is requesting a loan for $1,000 to improve her business by buying a truck. This will make it easier for her to run and improve her business so that she can earn enough money to rebuild her house and make it more comfortable for her family to live in.

loans.use: to improve her business by buying a truck.

loans.name: Carlos Uriel

texts.es:
Carlos es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y buscar cada vez mejores oportunidades para brindarles a su esposa y su hijo de 7 años de edad una mejor calidad de vida. Fue por esto que desde hace unos años dejó su empleo donde devengaba un salario que no le alcanzaba para sostener todos los gastos de su hogar y comenzó su propio negocio de venta de productos de aseo, gaseosas, productos de uso personal y demás y así logró tener mejores ingresos y su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Carlos proviene de una familia que siempre ha tenido dificultades económicas, y por esto ahora que tiene la oportunidad les ayuda económicamente para que ellos salgan adelante y así puedan progresar sus padres y sus hermanos; además de esto, su esposa y su hijo pueden tener unas mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Con el ánimo de responder a unos grandes pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, Carlos busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de aseo y productos de uso personal para responder a los grandes pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

De esta manera superará la dificultad de capital que tiene en su negocio y podrá seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes. Además de que seguirá recibiendo los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar y seguir brindando una buena calidad de vida a su esposa y su hijo de 7 años.
texts.en:
Carlos is a person that has always been characterized as being very hard-working and looking for better opportunities to offer his wife and his 7 year-old son an improved quality of life.  It was because of this that several years ago he gave up his job where he yielded a salary that didn't manage to sustain all of the household expenses, and started his own business selling cleaning products, soft drinks, personal use products and the like.  Through this he attained higher earnings and a better quality of life for his family.

Carlos comes from a family that has always had economic difficulties.  Due to this, now that he has the opportunity he helps them economically so that they can get ahead and his parents and siblings can progress.  Moreover, his wife and son can have better economic opportunities.  Intending to respond to the large orders that his clients have made, Carlos is looking for a loan that will allow him to buy cleaning products and products of personal use to respond to the large orders.

In this way he will overcome the difficulty in procuring capital that he has in his business and he will be able to continue satisfying his client's needs.  Along with that he will continue to receive the income necessary to sustain his household expenses and continue offering a good quality of life to his wife and his 7 year-old son.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products and products of personal use to respond to the large orders that his clients have made.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
“Having a happy family is great, but being happy is not enough to live in reality and in this world”, is the aphorism of this 43 year old named Natividad. She is grateful for having a family that is very cooperative, loveable and caring. This motivates her to work harder in pursuing security for her family. She is imagining for a happier family through having a better living. 

Natividad is currently operating a sari-sari (variety) store business and seeking for additional working capital. PHP 20,000 would be helpful in rotating-in supplies for her business. The funds would be used to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits. She is hoping that, through her belief in God, hard work and the loan availed, she will be having happy family at the same time as happy living.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Jenny Marcela

texts.es:
Jenny es una joven emprendedora que al ver que en su hogar no contaban con recursos económicos suficientes para poder pagar sus estudios universitarios, decidió iniciar su propio negocio para sostener sus propios gastos y también aportar económicamente en su hogar para que sus padres tengan la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad vida en el hogar. Desde hace unos años aprendió la actividad de la venta de mercancía por parte de su madre quien se dedicaba a esta actividad y desde entonces ofrece productos de uso personal a sus clientes. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y el buen servicio que ofrece ahora tiene muy buenos pedidos de sus clientes, pero debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital para responder por ellos, busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de uso personal para responder a los pedidos que han hecho sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es poder pagar sus estudios universitarios y progresar económicamente. Hace poco sufrió una grave enfermedad y esto hizo que su negocio estuviera sin movimiento por un tiempo, pero ahora que retomó quiere recuperar el tiempo y lograr conseguir el dinero para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jenny is a young entrepreneur who seeing that in her home there aren't sufficient economic resources to be able to pay for her university studies, she decided to start her own business in order to sustain her own expenses and also to financially contribute to her household so that her parents have the opportunity to have a higher quality of life at home. For several years she learned the business of selling merchandise from her mother who did this activity for a living and since then offers personal use products to her clients. Thanks to the good quality of these products and the good service that she offers she now has a good amount of requests from her customers, but since she doesn't have the capital to put forward for them, she is seeking out a loan that allows her to buy the personal use products to respond to the requests that her customers have made.

Her great dream is to be able to pay for her university studies and progress economically. Recently she fell seriously ill and this made her business close down for a while, but now she returned. She wants to make up for the the time and achieve obtaining the funds for her studies.

loans.use: to buy personal use products to respond to her customers' requests.

loans.name: Hellenid

texts.es:
Hellenid es una joven emprendedora de 19 años de edad que se encuentra casada y tiene una hija de 2 años de edad a quien siempre ha querido brindarle todo lo necesario para su crecimiento, por esto trabaja fuertemente todos los días con el ánimo de ofrecer en su hogar ingresos con los que pueda aportar económicamente junto con su esposo para tener una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar. Desde hace un tiempo aprendió la actividad de la venta de ganado de su familia que se han dedicado a esta actividad y así cuando vio la necesidad de generar ingresos se dedicó a esta actividad contando con algo de experiencia. Gracias a este negocio en su hogar han logrado tener una mejor calidad de vida y superar las dificultades económicas que han presentado en anteriores tiempos. Debido a que tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes los cuales no puede satisfacer inmediatamente, Hellenid busca apoyo en un préstamo que le permita comprar 4 terneras con las cuales pueda satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá seguir con su negocio brindando una buena calidad de vida en su hogar y su hija tendrá la oportunidad de tener mejor calidad de vida y crecer en un hogar con mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Hellenid, 19 years old, is an entrepreneurial young woman. She is married and has a 2-year-old daughter. She has always wanted to provide everything necessary for her daughter to grow. For this reason she works hard every day with the aim of contributing income to the household, together with her husband, in order to have a better quality of life in the household. Some time ago she learned how to sell cattle from her family, which does this, so when she saw the need to generate income she began this work having had some experience. Thanks to this business, her family has succeeded in having a better quality of life and rising above the economic difficulties that have presented themselves in previous times. Due to the fact that she has large orders from her customers that she cannot immediately fill, Hellenid is looking for support in a loan that will allow her to buy 4 calves, with which she can fill her customers' orders.

In this way she can continue with her business, bringing a better quality of life to her household. Her daughter will have the opportunity to have a better quality of life and to grow up in a home with better economic opportunities to move forward.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves, with which she can fill her customer's orders

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn is 52 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up pigs for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 daily. All of her children are employed. They earn about $20 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Thoeurn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa  se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos, y debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, decidió iniciar con su propio negocio con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pudiera contribuir económicamente en su hogar y así tener una mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace 2 años aproximadamente montó un servicio de comidas donde también ofrece a sus clientes la venta de productos de la canasta familiar; dado que el negocio está ubicado en una autopista principal, sus clientes son principalmente camioneros y viajeros que circulan por la zona. Con el ánimo de ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Rosa aspira a que un préstamo le permita comprar mesas y silletería con la cual pueda prestar un mejor servicio de comidas a sus clientes.

De esta manera hará de su negocio más llamativo para los clientes y así sus ventas aumentarán considerablemente, permitiendo generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y así contribuir a tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and has three children.  Because the income her husband generates is not enough to support the household expenses, she decided to start her own business.  She did this with the thought of generating income with which she could contribute financially to her household.  This way they could have a better quality of life.

She started a food business approximately two years ago, and she also sells her customers basic needs products.  Given that her business is located on a main highway, her customers are primarily truck drivers and people who move about the area.  

With the idea of offering better service to her customers, Rosa applies for a loan that will allow her to buy tables and chairs.  With those items she will be able to provide her customers with better food service.

This will make her business more attractive to her customers, and her sales will increase considerably.  This will allow her to generate greater income for her household.  This way she will contribute to having a better quality of life and greater opportunities for financial advancement.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs in order to provide her customers with better food service.

loans.name: Jamilton Brainer

texts.es:
Jamilton es una joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad que aprendió la actividad de la agricultura por parte de su padre y gracias a esto ha logrado conseguir oportunidades laborales y así contribuir económicamente en su hogar para que la calidad de vida y las condiciones económicas de sus padres mejores considerablemente. Desde hace muchos años, cuando su padre le enseñó a trabajar, Jamilton ha conseguido trabajo con campesinos de la zona quienes le pagan un salario por el día trabajado, pero ahora que quiere montar su propio cultivo, Jamilton busca un préstamo que le permita comprar semillas, abonos, riegos y demás para iniciar su propio cultivo de verduras.

De esta manera podrá salir adelante y progresar económicamente para que su familia también tenga la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas. Su mayor sueño es estudiar, por esto espera que con su propio cultivo tenga las oportunidades económicas de pagarse sus propios estudios.
texts.en:
Jamilton is an enterprising youth who is 22 years old.  His father taught him how to farm, and thanks to this he has been able to get work and contribute financially to the household, substantially improving the quality of life and the economic conditions of his parents.  Many years ago, when his father taught him to work, Jamilton started working as a farmhand in the area and was paid a daily salary for his work.  But now he wants to farm on his own.  Jamilton is seeking a loan to buy seeds, manure, irrigation supplies and other supplies to start his own crop of vegetables.

In this way, he will be able to get ahead and make economic progress so that his family will have a better quality of life and better economic opportunities.  His main dream is to get an education, and he hopes that with his own cultivations, he will have the economic resources to pay for his own education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, irrigation supplies and other supplies to grow vegetables

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary Luz es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por querer brindar a su esposo y sus hijos una buena calidad de vida, es por esto que debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no estaban siendo suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, decidió abrir su propio negocio para así tener otra fuente de ingresos para la familia. Fue así como con unos ahorros y mucho esfuerzo montó un restaurante donde ofrece a sus clientes desayunos, almuerzos y comidas, y gracias a la buena atención que ofrece ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes. Desde que abrió su restaurante las condiciones económicas de su familia han mejorado considerablemente, permitiéndoles a sus hijos tener el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad y también tener una mejor calidad de vida en toda su familia. Gracias a las ventas ahora puede generar 2 empleos y esto la hace sentir muy orgullosa, pues puede aportarle a 2 personas los ingresos que requieren para que sus familias también puedan salir adelante. Debido a que su negocio fue montado con muy bajo capital, no cuenta con tantas mesas y sillas como lo demandan sus clientes, por esto a la hora del almuerzo ha tenido que verse afectada por no poder atender más clientes por la poca capacidad que tiene en el restaurante; con el ánimo de mejorar esta situación, Mary Luz busca un préstamo para comprar sillas y mesas y así poder aumentar la capacidad de su restaurante y ya no perderse de atender clientes por no tener donde ubicarlos.

Así espera que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá atender a muchos clientes que antes no tenía capacidad de atender. Además, los ingresos para su hogar aumentarán considerablemente y su familia seguirá gozando de una muy buena calidad de vida y hasta mejores oportunidades económicas para pagarles una educación universitaria a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mary Luz is a person who has always been known for wanting to give her husband and children a better quality of life.  The income her husband generates is not enough to support the household expenses.  That is why she decided to open her own business in order to have another source of income for the family.

That is how, with some savings and a lot of effort, she established a restaurant where she offers her customers breakfast, lunch, and other food.  Thanks to the good service that she offers, she has managed to win over a great number of customers.

Ever since she opened her restaurant her family’s financial conditions have improved considerably.  This allows her children to have access to a better quality of education.  It also allows the whole family to have a better quality of life.

Thanks to her sales she is now able to generate two jobs, and this makes her feel very proud.  She is able to contribute to the income of two people who need it for their families.  Also, they can get ahead.

Because the business was started with very little capital, she does not have enough table and chairs to meet the customer demand.  Therefore, her lunch business has been affected by not being able to tend to more customers.  This is because of the restaurant’s small capacity.

With the thought of improving this situation, Mary Luz is looking for a loan to buy chairs and tables.  This way she will be able to increase her restaurant’s capacity.  She will not lose customers because she does not have a place to seat them.

She hopes that her sales will increase considerably this way.  She will be able to tend to a lot of customers that she previously did not have the capacity to serve.  Also, her household income will increase considerably.  Her family will continue enjoying a very good quality of life.  They will even have better financial opportunities to pay for their children’s university education.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to increase the seating capacity at her restaurant so that she that she does not lose customers.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que siempre ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida en su hogar, por esto tiene su negocio de servicio de transporte con el cual contribuye económicamente junto con su esposo al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar y así pueden brindar a sus 3 hijos una buena calidad de vida. Desde hace muchos años que tiene este negocio y gracias al tiempo de experiencia ha logrado hacerse conocida entre las personas de su municipio y esto hace que sus clientes aumenten cada vez más, lo que le permite tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y así mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Debido a que su coche se encuentra muy deteriorado y la opción de repararlo o hacerle mantenimiento saldría igual de costoso que comprar uno nuevo, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar un coche nuevo para reemplazar el existente y seguir prestando el servicio de transporte.

De esta manera mejorarán sus condiciones laborales permitiéndole a su familia tener mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia con la cual pueda brindar un hogar estable a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a person who has always wanted to provide the best quality of life for her household.  She has a transportation business that she runs along with her husband; with this business they support the household and provide their 3 children with a good quality of life.  She has had this business for many years, and thanks to these years of experience, she has managed to make herself known to the people in her municipality, so that over time her customer base has been growing.  This has allowed her to increase her household income, and has given her better economic opportunities for progress.  Because her carriage is now very deteriorated, the cost to repair it is the same as the cost of buying a new one.  Therefore, Maria is seeking a loan to buy a new carriage to replace the one she has, so that she can continue to provide transportation services. 

 In this way, she can improve her work conditions, allowing her family to have a better quality of life and better economic opportunities for progress.  Her main dream is to eventually buy her own house, to provide a stable home for her children.

loans.use: to buy a new carriage for her transportation business

loans.name: Alberto Alirio

texts.es:
Alberto inició con su actividad de panadería hace 30 años como una idea de negocio y de trabajo independiente ya que tomó algunos cursos. Comenzó con unas pocas herramientas y poco a poco fue agregándolo gracias a su trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación. Es un negocio familiar que trabaja junto con su esposa y lo abre todos los días. Gracias a su panadería ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos y brindarles educación, además logró conseguir su casa propia. Buscando satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, Alberto busca un préstamo para comprar insumos para la preparación de los panes y poder responder a la alta demanda de sus clientes.

Su  mayor sueño es salir adelante con su familia teniendo una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas. También sueña con poder comprar el local donde tiene ubicada su panadería.
texts.en:
Alberto started his bakery business 30 years ago as a business idea and a way of working for himself; he took courses.  He started out with just a few work tools and gradually added to them thanks to his work, effort and dedication.  It’s a family business where he works alongside his wife; they are open every day.  Thanks to his bakery he’s been able to raise his two children providing them with an education; he also managed to acquire a house of his own.  

Aiming at meeting customer demand, Alberto is looking for a loan to buy ingredients and supplies to bake bread and be able to meet demand.  His greatest dream is to get ahead with his family having a good quality of life and better economic opportunities.  He also dreams with being able to buy the locale his bakery is located in.

loans.use: to buy bread baking ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Valentina and her family live at Lanna. The primary source of income for the local village is derived through rice and corn farming. Valentina is involved in rice farming. She plants and harvests rice to sell to traders. From this kind of business, she is able to gain an income of PHP 30,000 each harvest season, twice in a year. She is very happy to have this business to sustain the expenses of paying school fees for her children while they were still studying. All of her children now live separately from her and have their own employment. 

Valentina is now requesting a loan of PHP48,000 to buy rice seeds to grow, fertilizers and pesticides for its sustenance. She would like to continue operating her small business so she will not rely on her children's remittances anymore.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to grow, fertilizers and pesticides for its sustenance.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is a simple farmer in the village of Sta. Teresita. He supports his family through this source of income. For 15 years in this production, he can say that it has improved their poor lifestyle. 

Arnel is doing his best to make developments every time he operates. Now comes again a season for sowing. He is seeking additional working capital in the amount of PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. He is hoping that, through the loan he avails, he can improve his farming business more in order to provide a good education to his three children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a twenty-six-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for five years. His hardships are customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations, and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home. His business goals are buying land to grow crops and moving his business to a more permanent location. Edward wants money to buy sugar, soap, salt, cups, plates, basins, matchboxes, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, salt, cups, plates, basins, matchboxes, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install flooring in his bakery.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is 48 years old and she is married to Cristobal. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children. Benilda is a farmer working in the village of Dabburab. She has been in this business for 10 years. She usually plants and harvests rice to sell.

Currently, Benilda is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy rice seed and fertilizers to sustain the growth of her rice field. She hopes that she can get the amount she has requested to further develop her business and she is promising to pay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizers to sustain the growth of her rice field.

loans.name: Renante

texts.en: Reynante is married and the father of three children who works hard to give his family a better life. He is 37 years old and earns a living by planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to high cost of commodities and the need to pay school fees for his children, he generates additional income by raising hogs. He is applying for a loan for PHP 35,000 to improve his businesses and increase his income so that he can better support his family and ensure that his children remain in school. He will use the loan to buy feed, vitamins and more piglets to raise. He believes that this loan will improve his businesses and allow him to become more successful.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 34 years old and has two school-aged children. He plans to improve their living conditions, to educate his children and give them a bright future. Despite hardships and difficulties he has encountered in life, he has the strong determination to reach his goals someday.

Ronnie has been a farmer for almost 10 years, planting rice, vegetables and raising livestock for sale. Since it is the major source of his income, he aims to improve his hog-raising business to increase his income. He is asking for an additional capital of P15,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising. He believes that someday, he will improve the business as he continue to work hard and strive even harder.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Due to hardship of living, Angelito is involved in a hog-raising business to earn additional income for his family. He is 42 years old and has three school-age children. He wants them to earn a degree and become professionals someday. Despite financial difficulty, he has the strong determination to improve his business to support the education of his children. 

Angelito planned to raise more pigs to sell but due to inadequate capital, he is asking for an additional of P35,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He mentioned that through patience and hard work, he can make an improvement in the business and is hoping that he will become successful in carrying out his plan.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Maryrose

texts.en:
Maryrose lives at Estefania with her spouse and five children. The family manages a corn field which serves as their primary source of income. They have been planting and harvesting corn to sell for over 10 years now. Maryrose is very happy though she only generates minimal income, just enough for the family's sustenance. 

Now she has decided to access a loan of P23,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming. She would like to keep generating good income from the farming business to finance her children's schooling. Someday, she hopes to earn good income to buy hogs to raise and sell as an additional source of income and finally achieve a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Teresita engages in hog-raising  to generate additional income. She is 57 years old and now a widow. She lives in a village with her four children. She aims to increase her income to satisfy their needs and support the education of her youngest child. In this regard, she planned to raise more pigs to sell. But due insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Sometimes she has encountered problems and difficulties in life, but she has the determination to improve her business and hopes that someday, she will become successful.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: Arsensia believes that patience and hard work will make it possible for her to improve her family's poor living condition. She is 49 years old, married, and has three school-age children. She engages herself in vegetable vending to help her husband generate income. She walks around their village to sell fruits and vegetables through home delivery. She tried to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional  PHP 5,000 to buy cabbage, ginger, tomatoes, beans, and bananas for sale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to improve the business and hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, ginger, tomatoes, beans and bananas for sale.

location.town: Brgy. Canabay, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue is 41 years old. She has three children who are in school. For 10 years, she has collected metal scrap and then sold it to recycling organizations. She earns 4,000,000 VND each month from it. She has participated in the SEDA credit program since 2007. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this cycle, she wants to borrow 7,840,000 VND to have capital to buy metal scrap then resell. Then, she hopes her business will generate enough profit for her children’s education fee.

loans.use: to buy metal scraps to re-sell.

loans.name: Jeanalyn

texts.en:
Jeanalyn, a 42-year-old mother of one, is a responsible housewife who is engaged in hog-raising to help her husband in earning income. Jeanalyn strives for success so that she can educate their child and give her a better future.

To improve her hog-raising business and make it a viable source of income, she is requesting a loan of P10,000.00 to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. Through patience and strong determination, Jeanalyn believes that she can improve the business and attain success.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
A hardworking man named Alberto lives at Estefania with his spouse and five children. Alberto is a farmer who grows corn to sell for profits. He patiently goes down the cornfield everyday to visit his crops to ensure good harvest. 

Alberto has insufficient funds now, that is why he joined ASKI and would like to borrow PHP 26,000 to buy corn seeds to grow and to buy farm inputs for crop sustenance. He hopes to keep growing as a successful farmer in order to finance his children's schooling. Three of his children attend school and he will be very happy and proud to see them as professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds to grow and farm inputs for crop sustenance.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana's goal in life is to provide a good education for all her children and to have a successful life. She has six children, but unfortunately not all of them had the opportunity to finish a degree because of financial difficulty. Some of them got married after finishing high shool. She feels guilty about this, but she still determined to help them in times of need. 

Juliana and her spouse manage a hectare corn field, which they plant and harvest to sell for income. They have been doing this for over 15 years. The income from the business goes for meals, bills at home and revolving capital for the next planting season. 

Juliana hopes to produce an abundant harvest but she has insufficient funds now. She is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for use in farming. Her photo was taken outside her home as she was on her way to the cornfield. 

With continuous hard work, determination and patience, Juliana believes to achieve economic stability someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is a farmer from Baybayog. He is married and has two children. His wife runs a small store. Joey aims to give the best education to his children as he feels it is the only legacy he can pass on. 

Joey untiringly works in his rice field to ensure a good harvest. Now, he is borrowing to keep developing his skills in managing the farming business and to be able to gain more profits in his business. He is asking for PHP 15,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to be used in farming. In return, Joey promises to pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, insecticides use in farming.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 40, married and a mother of three. She and her husband aim to uplift their living status to give their children a better life. Despite hardships and difficulties in life, they have the determination to reach their goal. Juanita runs a small variety store while her husband cultivates their farmland. She has been operating her business for almost three years and earns an income of P8,000 a month that she utilizes for their daily consumption and allowances of her children in school. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, she aims to improve the business to earn sufficient income. She is asking for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy snack foods, candies, canned goods, noodles, bar soap, beverages, soft drinks and seasonings for sale. She is hoping that someday, her business will grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, candies, canned goods, noodles, bar soap, beverages, soft drinks and seasonings for sale

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien is 44 years old. She got married and has two children. They are all grown. She sells plastic bags for a living. Normally, she earns 4,500,000 VND per month from this business. She has taken part in the crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to enlarge her business selling plastic bags.

loans.use: to enlarge her business selling plastic bags.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a thirty-one-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for two years. He started with 500,000 shillings and now has 1,200,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations, and inflation. His personal goals are self education, educating his children, and building a permanent home. His business goals are to move his business to a more permanent location and to expand his business into new markets. John wants money to buy sugar, soap, and a fridge for the shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and a fridge for the shop.

loans.name: Thuc

texts.en: Thuc is 52 years old. She has two adult children. For 20 years, she has collected metal scrap and then sold it to recycling organizations. She earns 3,000,000 VND each month from it. She has participated in the SEDA credit program since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to have capital to buy metal scrap to resell, and to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to have capital to buy metal scrap to resell, and to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 52 with five children living in Masindi-Uganda. He started by selling milk then got start-up capital for his retail shop business. He desires to educate his children and buy land to grow crops.
His business faces a problem of inadequate capital to purchase merchandise, and high fuel and transportation costs. Alfred wants a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and tea leaves to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is 32 years old. She has two children who go to school. She sells chicken eggs for a living. Normally, she earns 3,000,000 VND per month. She has taken part in the crediting program with SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to increase her stock of poultry eggs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of poultry eggs.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung is 37 years old. She has three children who are studying at school. She has sold noodles for a living for 12 years. From her small business, she earns 4,500,000 VND a month. She has taken part in the crediting program of SEDA since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to increase her noodle sales and raise pigs.

loans.use: to increase her noodle sales and raise pigs.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy was born in 1976. Her husband is a broom maker and she is a broom supplier. They have done this job for eight years and they earn from it 8,000,000 VND per month. She has a daughter who is in the tenth grade and a son who is in the third grade. She has participated in the credit program of SEDA since 2006. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,630,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND again to enlarge her broom business. Then she will be able to let her children continue to go to school.

loans.use: to enlarge her broom business.

loans.name: Nyabuliko Abagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Winfred is a 42-year-old  married woman with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been operating a salon business for eight years and she sold off one of her cows to start the business.

She is being faced with the problem of inadequate capital to meet  the different needs of her customers and well equip her salon.

She has a personal goal of educating her children and building a permanent home and her business goal is expanding her business into new marketplaces.

Winfred wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her salon. She is a member of the above-mentioned group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for the salon.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is 27 years old. She has just gotten married. She cooks and sells several kinds of sweet soup in the market for a living. She earns 3,500,000 VND a month. She has participated in the crediting program with SEDA since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to enlarge her stall of sweet soup in the market.

loans.use: to enlarge her stall of sweet soup in the market.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Tinh is 34 years old. She has two children who are studying at school. She is a carpenter. From her small business, she earns 4,000,000 VND per month. She has taken part in SEDA's credit program since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to enlarge her carpentry studio. With the profits, she hopes to pay for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to enlarge her carpentry studio.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyn, a 42-year-old married mother of four living in Masindi, Uganda, has operated a retail business for the past 15 years, using the proceeds to pay school fees for her children. Price fluctuation is her major challenge.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell. Educating her children and diversifying her business are her dreams.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Kanyatsi Tulibaghuma Group

texts.en: Robert is a thirty-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. For three years, he has been in the motorcycle business and also has a retail shop. He started with 300,000 shillings and now has 2,500,000 shillings as working capital. His biggest hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is expanding his business into new markets. Robert wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is aged 39 and she is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her three children. She began by selling produce to get start-up capital. Inadequate capital to purchase stock is her major challenge that hinders her business. Her dream is to educate her children and diversify her business. Joan wants a loan to buy  feeds and chicks for her poultry project.

loans.use: to buy more feeds and chicks for her poultry project.

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phuong was born in 1982. She has two children who are both little. Her husband and she sell beer and beverages for a living. They earn 15,000,000 VND per month. She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2011. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to enlarge her business of selling beer and beverages. She hopes the benefit will help her to let all of her children go to school.

 Mr Lam has a child. He is a carpenter. He wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to buy carpentry machines to support his job. 

 Mrs Thu has two children. She has a barber shop. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to buy barber tools for her shop. 

 Mrs Thuy has a child. She has a small beverage stall. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to upgrade her stall. 

 Mrs Huong has two children. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to support her teaching job.

loans.use: to enlarge her business of selling beer and beverages.

loans.name: Ngau

texts.en: Ngau is 43 years old. She has two children who are studying at school. She is a tailor. From her small business, she gains 3,500,000 VND a month. She has taken part in SEDA's credit program since 2008. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to support her tailoring business and buy phone cards to sell.

loans.use: to support her tailoring business and buy phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 49 years old, married, and has four children who are still in school. She helps her husband maintain the farming business which they have cultivated for over 10 years now. They plant and harvest rice to sell. Rosemarie would like to improve crop production so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to invest for farm inputs. She will buy fertilizers and pay labor costs. This will help ensure healthy crops during harvest, leading to an increase in profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs for farming.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is 29 years old. She has two children who are studying at school. She has a pharmacy store to earn a living. From her small business, she earns 3,500,000 VND a month. She has taken part in the crediting program with SEDA since 2008. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to diversify her pharmacy list to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: to diversify her pharmacy list to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is living at Baybayog with her spouse and five children. All of her children attend school and need daily allowances. Aside from running a store, Nida also helps her husband maintain their farming business. They plant and harvest rice. Harvested crops will be offered to traders in their village.

Nida would like to keep improving their farming business but she has insufficient funds now. From this, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to sustain her crops with fertilizers and insecticides. 

Someday, she hopes to generate a steady income from their businesses for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Zakalia

texts.en: Zakalia is a forty-two-year-old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been teaching for fourteen years. His personal goals are educating his children, buying a car, and building a permanent home. Zakalia intends to use the money to buy building materials to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete his house.

loans.name: Atanasi

texts.en: Atanasi is a forty-seven-year-old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been teaching for twenty-six years and he is happy that by teaching he has been able to realize his dream of inspiring youth. His hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. His business goal is buying land to grow crops and his personal goal is educating his children. Atanasi wants money to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en: Mrs. Lieu was born in 1960. She has three children who are adults. Her husband raises musk ducks. He earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Mrs Lieu helps her husband to raise musk ducks. She also rents billiard tables. She earns 6,000,000 VND per month. The total income of her family is 11,000,000 VND per month. She has participated in SEDA's crediting program since 2006. In the last cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to raise more musk ducks.

loans.use: to raise more musk ducks.

loans.name: Kenia Judith

texts.es:
Kenia, de 27 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 4 años, vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula.
Hace más de 6 años que Kenia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, vende ropa, sandalias, zapatillas, artículos de limpieza por pedidos y también genera otros ingresos, ella elabora nacatamales y pasteles  para vender por encargo . Anteriormente ella estudio repostería y también vendía mercadería cuando le encargaban, allí comenzó su negocio. Ella vende en su casa y de manera ambulante. El préstamo que solicita actualmente por 15,000 Lempiras lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería nueva americana para surtir más el negocio y tener siempre productos que vender y poder aumentar las ventas. Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita a ODEF y agradece por el apoyo brindado, también ahora a Kiva que está apoyando a pequeños negocios. Su meta es estabilizar su negocio en un local fijo y mejorar las ventas y sus ingresos para ayudar a su hija.
texts.en:
Kenia, age 27, is a single mother with a four-year-old daughter. She lives in the town of San Pedro Sula.

For more than six years, Kenia has been selling general merchandise such as clothing, sandals, slippers, and cleaning products by request. She also prepares and sells tamales and pastries that have been pre-ordered. Kenia previously studied dessert-making and also sold pre-ordered merchandise. As a result, she started her business. Kenia sells from home and also as a traveling merchant.

The loan she is currently requesting is in the amount of 15,000 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, such as American clothing, so that she will have more inventory for her business. She also wants to have a constant stock of products to sell so that she can increase her sales. This is the second loan she has requested from ODEF and she is grateful for the support that has been provided. She also expresses her appreciation to Kiva for supporting small businesses. Her goal is to stabilize her business by acquiring a fixed location and improving her sales and income so that she can help her daughter.

loans.use: to buy American clothing.

loans.name: Justin

texts.fr:
Justin, âgé de 36 ans est marié et père de deux garçons dont le premier est inscrit à l’école primaire. Depuis neuf ans, il a commencé l’activité de commerce général avec son frère aîné qu’il a ensuite quitté il y a un an pour s’installer pour son propre compte dans le village de Guéguéré. 
Avec ce prêt, il voudra assurer la vente de foyers améliorés et à gaz dans le but de lutter contre la déforestation au niveau de sa localité et améliorer ses revenus. Il achètera ainsi 2 foyers à gaz pour la revente auprès des populations. Les revenus serviront à financer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et à l’entretien de sa famille et il travaillera à l’adoption de ces équipements économes par les populations.
texts.en:
Justin is 36 years of age, married, and has two sons, the oldest of whom is in elementary school. Nine years ago he started a general retail business with his older brother. However, he left this business a year ago to set up his own business in the village of Guéguéré.

Justin would like to use this loan to sell energy-efficient stoves and gas stoves, with the goal of fighting against deforestation in his town and improving his income. He therefore plans to buy two gas stoves for resale to the local population. He will use his income to finance his children’s education and to provide for his family, and will also work towards introducing this money-saving equipment to the local population.

loans.use: To buy gas stoves for resale.

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Mrs Tan was born in 1963. Her three children are all married and have their own families. Her husband is a carpenter with a salary of 3,000,000 VND. Mrs Tan has sold clothes for ten years. She earns 5,000,000 VND per month from it. She has participated in the credit program from Kiva partner SEDA since 2006. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid it on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Juliyasi

texts.en: Juliyasi is 26 year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda.  He has been in the motorcycle transport business for a period of four years. With the income earned he has been able to provide basics to his household members. Inadequate capital is affecting the business.  Therefore, he would like to educate his children and diversify his business by buying land to grow crops. Juliyasi wants a loan to buy land to grow a crop.

loans.use: to buy land to grow a crop.

loans.name: Tinh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tinh was born in 1962. Her husband is dead. She has a daughter who is a TV editor. Her daughter's income is about 8,000,000 VND. For six years, Mrs. Tinh has been making cooked food to sell in the market. She earns 2,000,000 VND from this stall. She has taken part in SEDA's crediting program since 2006. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy more ingredients and to enlarge her stall.

Mrs. Huong is 39 years old. She has two children. She is a broom maker. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to make more brooms to sell.
Mrs. Hoa is 38 years old. She has two children. She is a broom seller. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy more brooms to resell.
Mrs. Huong is 34 years old. She has three children. She sells shoes. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy more shoes to resell.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and to enlarge her stall.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано  1958 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Она сотрудничает с нашей организацией  с 2006 года. Рано имеет небольшой магазин возле дома, где торгует продуктами питания. Этот магазин она построила вместе с мужем в 2006 году. Ее основные покупатели соседи и местные жители. Также у них есть небольшой участок земли, там она с семьей выращивают  различную сельскохозяйственную культуру, сейчас у нее в огороде растут огурцы, помидоры и лук. В настоящий момент она получает кредит  для увеличение товара своего магазина.
texts.en: Rano was born in 1958.  She is married and has two children.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2006.  Rano has a small store near her home, where she sells food products.  She built this store together with her husband in 2006.  Her neighbors and local residents are the main store customers.  Also, Rano has a small plot of land, where she and her family grow carious agricultural crops and currently have cucumbers, tomatoes and onions growing in their garden.  At the present time, Rano is requesting this loan to increase the amount of merchandise in her store.

loans.use: to increase the amount of merchandise in her store

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Mrs Hien was born in 1976. She has two children who are learning in primary school and secondary school. Her husband is a worker at Dong Anh. His salary is 3,000,000 VND per month. Mrs Hien sells sedge mats and poultry food. She earns 5,000,000 VND per month. The total income of her family is 8,000,000 VND per month. She has participated in the credit program from Kiva partner SEDA since 2006. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid it on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more sedge mats to resell.

loans.use: to buy more sedge mats to resell.

loans.name: Davlatbi

texts.ru: Давлатби – 50 лет, вдова, имеет 4 детей. Занимается торговлей обуви (галошей, резиновых тапочек). Опыт в этой сфере – 15 лет. Её занятие является основным доходом для семьи. Давлатби кредитуется в нашей организации с 2009 года и ни разу не нарушала условия кредитования, а также показала себя с хорошей стороны. Этот кредит Давлатби - 6 по счету. На полученный кредит она планирует увеличить свой товарооборот, закупить сезонную обувь. С каждого дохода она откладывает необходимую сумму, так как она мать-одиночка и ей нужно поднимать 4 детей. Давлатби выражает свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Davlatbi is 50 years old, a widow and has four children.  She is involved in selling shoes (galoshes and rubber slippers).  She has 15 years of experience in this field.  Her business is the primary source of income for the family.  Davlatbi has been obtaining financing from our organization since 2009, never violated the financing terms and showed herself well.  This is Davlatbi's sixth loan.  She wants to use this loan to increase her goods turnover and buy seasonal shoes.  She sets aside a necessary amount from each of her earnings because she is a single mother and needs to raise four children.  Davlatbi expresses her gratitude to our organization for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a seasonal selection of shoes

loans.name: My

texts.en: Mrs. My was born in 1958. Her husband is dead. She has three children who are all adults. Mrs. My makes breakfast and sells groceries in the market. She earns 4,000,000 VND every month from this business. She has participated in SEDA's crediting program since 2006. In the last cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy ingredients to make food and to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food

loans.name: Riskul

texts.ru: Рискул преданная мать, которая борется изо дня в день, чтобы обеспечить лучшее для своей семьи. Двадцать лет назад, ей пришла в голову идея, чтобы начать скотоводства внести свой вклад в семейный бюджет. Она воспитывает четверых сыновей. Муж находиться в Кахзастане, и каждый месяц присылает деньги. Рискул со  своими  молодыми детьми  стрижет коз  и продает их пряжу на рынке. В настоящий момент она получила кредит для приобретение скота. Она надеется также как и в прошлом году увеличить поголовье скота и свой капитал.
texts.en: Riskul is a devoted mother, who fights day after day to provide the best for her family.  She got an idea to start an animal husbandry business 20 years ago in order to add her contribution to the family budget.  She is raising four sons.  Her husband is in Kazakhstan and sends money home every month.  Riskul and her young children shear goats and sell yarn at a market.  Currently, she obtained a loan to purchase livestock.  She hopes to increase her livestock headcount and her capital just like last year.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Anorbi

texts.ru:
Анорби родилась 1963 году в Кулябе. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Муж Анорби работает электриком. Сама Анорби медсестра по специальности. Она официально не работает специальности, но подрабатывает помогая соседям. 
В основном Анорби занимается животноводством. Она разводит мелко-рогатый скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа овец и коз. Таким образом Анорби хочет расширит свою деятельность и увеличить доходы семьи.
texts.en: Anorbi was born in 1963 in Kulob.  She is married and has five children.  Her husband works as an electrician.  Anorbi is a nurse; however, she does not officially work in her profession, but instead works part-time helping her neighbors.  Anorbi is primarily involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds small livestock at home.  She has been involved in this business for four years.  Anorbi is requesting this loan to buy sheep and goats in order to expand her business and increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga was born in 1963. Her husband is a building worker. He gets 3,000,000 VND each month. Her children are all adults. Mrs Nga raises chickens for a living. She also has a pension of 3,000,000 VND per month. The total income of her family is 7,000,000 VND. She has participated in the credit program from Kiva partner since 2007. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid it on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest more in her farm so that she can get more money from raising chickens.

Mrs. Binh is 56 years-old. She has one child. Mrs. Binh is a cooked food maker. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND in order to enlarge her food stall.

Mrs Thanh is 29 years-old. She has two children. Mrs. Thanh is a tofu maker. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to make more tofu to sell.

Mrs. Lien is 45 years-old. She has two children. Mrs. Lien is a dry stuff seller. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest in her market stall of dry stuff.

loans.use: to invest in her farm so that she can get more money from raising chickens.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a 28 year-old hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. For four years he has been running a produce business and also riding a motorcyle for business purposes. He started this business with capital received from harvesting and selling his maize and beans.  In order to shorten the supply chain he then decided to buy from other famers and sell at a profit.  Inadequate capital is the factor affecting his business.  He would like to educate his two children and own one of the biggest food stores in town.  Benson wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ulpiya

texts.ru: Улпия проживает в районе Яван. Ей 54 года. Он замужем. У нее 10 детей. Улпия имеет дехканское хозяйство, где она вместе со всей семьей занимается растениеводством. Она в основном выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности Улпия занимается уже четыре года. Она берет кредит для посева овощей.
texts.en: Ulpiya lives in the Yavan district.  She is 54 years old, married and has ten children.  Ulpiya has a dekhan farm, where she and her family are involved in agriculture.  She primarily grows vegetables and plants fruit trees.  Ulpiya has been in this business for four years.  She is requesting this loan to sow vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Ana; la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de productos de belleza ,ella vende lo que son cremas ,colonias,perfumes,talcos entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que lo pone cada dia  a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus amistades y familiares,la socia desea poder continuar trabajando en su negocio ya que mediante este la socia apoya economicamente a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mas productos de belleza para asi poder ofrecer a sus clientes como perfumes.
 
La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Sra. Ana. She continues to engage in her business of selling beauty products. Ana sells crèmes, colognes, perfumes, talcum powders, and other products. She enjoys working in this business and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day. Ana is a responsible and industrious individual who has tremendous drive to continue working on behalf of her family. She sells her products as a traveling merchant to her friends and relatives. Ana wants to continue working in her business so that she can support her family financially.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more beauty products, such as perfumes, to offer to her customers. Ana is satisfied with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa, jeune commerçant de 36 ans, a accepté de travailler avec Entrepreneurs du Monde dans le village de Oronkua, localisé dans la province du IOBA, pour vendre des foyers métalliques améliorés afin de diversifier les articles qu’il vend dans sa boutique depuis 5 ans. 

Pour financer l’acquisition d’un premier stock de 25 foyers améliorés, il a opté de contracter ce crédit. Cette activité permettra notamment aux femmes de sa localité de faire des économies en argent, en bois et en temps. Ainsi il contribuera à rendre accessible les foyers améliorés qui ne sont pas encore disponibles sur place à Oronkua. En plus, ces équipements serviront à attirer plus de clients vers sa boutique, améliorant donc ses revenus qu’il utilisera pour subvenir aux différents besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Moussa is a young store-owner aged 36. He agreed to work with Entrepreneurs du Monde in the village of Oronkua, located in the province of Ioba, to sell energy-efficient metal stoves. This will allow him to diversify the items he has sold in his store for the past five years.

Moussa decided to take out this loan to finance the acquisition of an initial purchase of 25 energy-efficient stoves. This will allow mainly women in the area where he lives to save money, wood and time. He will also help with improving access to energy-efficient stoves, as they are not yet available in Oronkua. His equipment will attract more customers to his store, therefore improving his income, which he will use to meet his family’s various needs.

loans.use: To finance the acquisition of an initial stock of 25 energy-efficient stoves.

loans.name: Janeth Milena

texts.es: Janeth es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijas. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace. Ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos para máquinas. En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ha aprendido a ahorrar y a compartir o trabajar en grupo, entre compañeras del Banco Comunal se apoya mutuamente. Su sueño para el futuro es emprender una empresa y que su negocio crezca. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio, para la compra de repuestos para máquinas.
texts.en:
Janeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Maria Celeste”. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of two daughters. Janeth is a member of FINCA Peru who earns her living by selling machine parts. Throughout the entire time she has been a member of FINCA Peru, she has learned how to save and also how to share and work as part of a group. Janeth and the other members of her Communal Bank mutually support one another. Her dream for the future is to establish a company and see that business grow.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in her business so that she can buy machine parts.

loans.use: to buy machine parts.

loans.name: Soursag-Yir Parfait

texts.fr:
Soursag-Yir Parfait détient une boutique de vente d’articles divers et une buvette au marché de Koper, localité située dans la province du Ioba au Burkina Faso. Il mène ces activités depuis une vingtaine d’années, depuis l’âge de 22 ans.

Confronté à des difficultés financis, avec ce prêt, il a acheté 5 foyers à gaz qu’il va revendre au niveau de sa zone pour faciliter l’accès des populations aux produits énergétiques. Pour lui, ce prêt lui permettra d’améliorer ses revenus afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et surtout permettre à ses enfants d’aller à l’école car Parfait est marié et père de trois enfants. En plus il envisage d’être un leader pour la cause de la protection de l’environnement au niveau de sa localité.
texts.en:
Soursag-Yir Parfait runs a store selling miscellaneous articles and a refreshment area in the market in Koper, a town located in the province of Ioba in Burkina Faso. He has had this business for about 20 years, since he was 22 years of age.

Faced with financial difficulties, Soursag-Yir Parfait has used this loan to buy five gas stoves, which he will resell in his area to improve the population's access to energy products. The loan will allow him to improve his income so that he can provide for his family and, most importantly, so that his children can go to school, as he is a married father of three children. He also hopes to become a leader for the environmental protection cause in his town.

loans.use: To buy gas stoves for resale in the surrounding area.

loans.name: Ouiraogo

texts.fr: Ayant connu Entrepreneurs du Monde il y a 3 mois, Ouiraogo a associé l’activité de commercialisation de foyers améliorés et à gaz à la vente d’articles ordinaires de boutique qu’il tient depuis 12 ans au marché de Zambo pour accroître ses bénéfices qui serviront à l’agrandissement de sa boutique. Agé de 34 ans, le prêt lui permettra d’acheter 5 foyers à gaz pour favoriser l’accès à des produits énergétiques destinés à la réalisation d’économies en argent, en temps par les populations du village de Zambo où il n’y a pas de vendeurs de foyers améliorés et à gaz.
texts.en:
Ouiraogo heard about Entrepreneurs du Monde three months ago, and decided to add the sale of energy efficient stoves and gas stoves to the sale of general items in a store he has owned for 12 years in the market in Zambo. He made this decision to increase his profits, which will allow him to expand his store. 

Ouiraogo is 34 years of age, and this loan will allow him to buy five gas stoves. This will improve access to energy products geared towards saving both money and time for the population of the village of Zambo, where nobody currently sells energy-efficient and gas stoves.

loans.use: To buy gas stoves for resale in his village.

loans.name: Gilberte

texts.fr:
Gilberte est une femme mariée de 42 ans et mère de trois enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Habitant en la ville de Ouagadougou, elle y exerce une activité de vente de produits de beauté féminins et des tenues de femme. En plus de ces articles qu’elle vend dans sa boutique ouverte il y a 8 mois, Gilberte est confrontée à des difficultés financières pour associer la vente de produits énergétiques au niveau de sa boutique pour satisfaire les besoins de ses clients. Ce commerce, elle l’avait débuté il y a deux ans avant d’ouvrir sa boutique.

Le présent prêt lui permettra ainsi de s’approvisionner en 10 foyers à gaz, 26 foyers métalliques améliorés et et 3 lampes solaires qu’elle va revendre afin d’améliorer ses revenus. Elle entend utiliser ces revenus pour accroître son activité et aider son mari à investir dans les études de ses trois enfants.
texts.en:
Gilberte is a 42-year-old married woman, and has three children who are all at school. She lives in the town of Ouagadougou, where she works selling women’s clothing and beauty products. She sells these items in a store she opened eight months ago. Gilberte has faced her financial difficulties by selling energy products in her store to meet the needs of her customers. She started this business two years ago, before opening her store.
