This loan will allow Gilberte to buy a supply of 10 gas stoves, 26 energy-efficient metal stoves, and three solar lamps, which she will resell to improve her income. She plans to use this income to expand her business, as well as to help her husband to pay for her three children’s education.

loans.use: To buy 10 gas stoves, 26 energy-efficient metal stoves, and three solar lamps for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Josephine Therese

texts.fr: Thérèse est une jeune femme de 30 ans,célibataire,mère de 02 enfants âgé entre 08 et 12 ans,les deux vont encore à l'école.Elle a également sous sa charge une autre personne.Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une parfumerie qu'elle gère dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 03 ans.Sa petite parfumerie fonctionne assez bien,mais cependant l'abscence d'une diversification de son activité,et la petitesse de son stock de lait de toilette est un problème car la demande en bijoux et en lait de toilette étant de plus en plus croissante,elle a du mal à satisfaire cette demande de sa clientèle.C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit qui l'aidera à  plus s'approvisionner en lait de toilette mais également en bijoux,ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle ,ce qui augmentera ses ventes et par conséquent ses bénéfices.Elle économisera une partie de ces bénéfices dans le but d'ouvrir dans un futur proche un bar et l'autre lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thérèse is a young woman, 30 years old, unmarried, and the mother two children, 8 and 12 years old, who are both still in school. She also has in her care another person. Thérèse is a merchant and has opened a perfume shop, which she has been running in a district in the capital for three years. Her small shop is operating well enough, however the problem is a lack of diversification in her business and also a meager stock of body lotions. This is because of a burgeoning demand for jewelry and body lotion. She has had trouble satisfying this customer demand. 

For these reasons, she is requesting a loan that will help her to stock up more on body lotions, as well as jewelry, enabling her to meet the needs of her customers. Her sales will then increase and her profits too as a result. 

She will save some of her profits with the goal of opening a bar in the near future, and the rest will enable her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and body lotions

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Mariée à un chauffeur et mère de 02 enfants qui sont âgés de 07 et 04ans, Madame Afiwa a pour profession boulangère. Elle fait le pain elle – même et le vend à toutes personnes. Une personne l’aide dans l’exécution de ses taches. Elle sollicite du crédit auprès de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en matières premières (farine de blé, sucre…)afin d'avoir un bon bénéfice et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Married to a driver, Ms. Afiwa is a mother of two children, 7 and 4 years old. She is a baker by profession. She makes the bread herself and sells it to anyone. One person helps her in carrying out her tasks. 

Ms. Afiwa is requesting a loan from WAGES to stock up on ingredients (wheat flour, sugar,…) to make a good profit and to make sure her family will thrive.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que se ha caracterizado por tener una gran fortaleza para superar las adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida, y gracias a esto hoy puede seguir saliendo adelante junto con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la actividad de la confección en busca de generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente para el sostenimiento de los gastos del hogar, y gracias al esfuerzo que ha puesto en su taller de confección ha logrado mejorar la calidad de vida en el hogar y brindarles a sus 3 hijos una educación de mejor calidad. El año pasado tuvo inconvenientes de salud, pues la operaron de las rodillas y esto hizo que tuviera que dejar de trabajar durante mucho tiempo, lo cual hizo un gran efecto negativo sobre las condiciones económicas del hogar, por esto ahora que ha logrado retomar su trabajo busca un préstamo que le permita comprar materias primas como telas, hilos, agujas, entre otros para sacar adelante sus confecciones y volver a tener mejores condiciones económicas en el hogar.

De esta manera podrá retomar su trabajo y seguir generando los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para brindar una buena calidad de vida, además de poder volver a contar con mejores oportunidades económicas en el hogar.
texts.en:
María is a person who has been noted for the great strength she’s had to overcome life’s adversities.  Thanks to this she’s getting ahead with her husband and three children.  She’s been sewing for the last ten years in order to generate income to contribute economically to cover household expenses and thanks to the effort she’s put into her workshop she’s attained an improved quality of life at home and has provided her three children with a better quality education.

Last year she had some health issues because she had knee surgery that kept her from working for a long time and this had a negative effect on household economic conditions.  She’s now resumed work and is looking for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy raw materials like fabric, needles and thread, among others to make her items and continue to have better economic conditions at home.  In this way she’ll be able to restart her work and continue generating income her home requires in order to be in better economic conditions at home.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh is 47 years old. She has three children who are adults and have their own families. She has sold noodles for a living for 15 years. From her small business, she earns 3,500,000 VND a month. She has taken part in SEDA's credit program since 2011. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to enlarge her business of noodle.
Dung is 33 years old. She wants to borrow 4,256,000 VND to support her teaching job.
Tran is 52 years old. She wants to borrow 5,5152,000 VND to buy scrap metal for recycling.

loans.use: to increase her sales of noodles.

loans.name: Maria Dalila

texts.es:
Maria ha tenido que superar la adversidad de ser madre soltera cabeza de hogar de sus 2 hijos menores de edad a quienes siempre les ha querido garantizar una buena educación y una buena calidad de vida, y por esto trabaja fuertemente todos los días para generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar. Desde hace aproximadamente 2 años cuando su ex esposo la abandonó, logró montar con unos ahorros y pidiendo dinero prestado una miscelánea donde ofrece toda clase de productos para el hogar y de uso personal, y gracias a esta puede generar los ingresos que requieren en su hogar. Debido a que su negocio ha logrado salir adelante y tener buenas ventas, Maria busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos para el hogar y de uso personal para surtir su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

De esta manera seguirá haciendo atractivo su negocio para los clientes y esto le permitirá tener buenas ventas para generar buenos ingresos para el sostenimiento de los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
María has had to overcome the adversity of being a single mother head of household; she has two minor children who she’s always wanted to provide a good education and quality of life for which is why she works hard every day to generate income needed at home.  

About two years ago when her husband abandoned her she used some savings and money she borrowed to open a variety store where she sells all kinds of items for the home and for personal use.  Thanks to this she’s able to generate needed household income.  

Because her business has managed to move forward and have good sales, María needs a loan to buy household and personal use items to stock the store and have a wider variety of products available for her customers.  In this way she will continue to make her business attractive to customers which will lead to good sales and income to support her home’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 48, living in Masindi, Uganda, and charged with the responsibility of looking after his four children. For the last 20 years, he has been operating a retail shop. Price fluctuations are the major challenge that he faces. His dreams are to own a supermarket, to educate his children, and to diversify his business to include farming. Charles wants a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 38 years old.  He lives in Kagadi, Uganda. For 15 years he has been trading in produce and the business has been very lucrative.

George is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy maize and coffee to sell.  Inadequate capital is the hardship affecting the business. He dreams of educating his children up to the university and buying a car to ease on his transport to different markets.  In the future, he would like to own a food store in town and diversify his business to include cattle rearing.

loans.use: to purchase maize and coffee.

loans.name: Daniel De Jesus

texts.es:
Daniel se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos a quienes gracias a su negocio ha logrado brindarles el acceso a una educación universitaria. Desde hace unos 6 años aproximadamente trabajaba en una empresa de computadores, y debido a que su salario no era suficiente para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar decidió montar su propio negocio en su casa donde ofrece el servicio de cibercafé a sus clientes, y así ha logrado mejorar las condiciones económicas del hogar para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a que su negocio lo montó con muy bajo capital, aún presenta algunas dificultades en el negocio, y ahora lo que evita que pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio es que el piso de su negocio está en condiciones muy precarias dado el invierno que ha azotado la región, por esto ahora que tiene la oportunidad busca un préstamo para realizar adecuaciones locativas en su cibercafé arreglando el piso que está en condiciones muy precarias.

De esta manera podrá arreglar el piso y sus clientes podrán tener un servicio de mejor calidad, esperando así que aumenten sus clientes y sus ventas puedan generarle mejores ingresos para una mejor economía en el hogar.
texts.en:
Daniel is married and has two children who thanks to his business he’s able to provide with university education.  About six years ago he worked for a computer firm but because his salary was insufficient to cover household expenses he decided to open a business of his own at home providing Internet café service for his customers.  This is how he’s succeeded in providing better economic conditions and a better quality of life at home.

Because he set up the business with little initial capital, he still has some obstacles to overcome and what is keeping him from being able to provide better service now is the floor that’s in very precarious condition due to the severe winter the region’s experienced.  Because of this he needs a loan to make physical improvements to the cybercafé repairing the floor that’s in very precarious condition.  In this way he will be able to repair the floor and his customers will be able to get better quality service.  He hopes thereby to increase his clientele and sales thus generating higher income for improve household economy.

loans.use: to repair the floor.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis Eduardo se encuentra casado, tiene 4 hijos y la fuente de ingresos para su hogar es un cultivo de verduras que ha trabajado durante más de 30 años. Actividad que aprendió de su padre quien desde muy temprana edad se la enseñó para que trabajara a su lado, y ahora gracias a toda esta experiencia es reconocido por tener productos de muy buena calidad y por esto sus clientes cada vez aumentan, permitiéndole tener mejores ventas para tener mejores ingresos para su hogar. El invierno ha hecho que su cultivo se deteriore bastante, y por esto busca un préstamo para comprar abonos, insecticidas y fungicidas y así reabonar sus cultivos de verduras.

De esta manera podrá tener en su cultivo productos de buena calidad y superar la adversidad del clima que ha hecho que sus productos se deterioren. Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo con su cultivo y así tener mejores ingresos para su hogar para brindar una buena calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Eduardo is married and has four children.  The source of income for his household is the cultivation of vegetables, work that he has been doing for over 30 years.  He learned this business activity from his parents.  They taught him this work so that he could work by their sides at a very early age.  

Now, thanks to all of this experience, he is known for having very good quality products.  Therefore, he gets more customers.  This allows him to have better sales in order to have improved income for his household. 

The winter has caused his crops to deteriorate quite a lot.  That is why he is looking for a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides.  This way he will re-fertilize his vegetable crops.  In this manner he will be able to have good quality crops and overcome the adverse climate that has caused these products to deteriorate.

His biggest dream is to continue working with his crops and to have better income for his household.  He wants this in order to give his household a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides to re-fertilize his vegetable crops.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a single lady with two children. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 200000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more shirts, skirts, and blouses.  She goes door-to-door selling used clothes.  She sells theses clothes retail and works six days a week. Her major business challenges are the rainy season and thieves. She aspires to get a permanent business location.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with seven children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She has a business of selling Irish potatoes. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes. She has been in this business for six years and works seven days a week at the market; she sells by wholesale only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation, and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Denis Del Socorro

texts.es:
Denis es madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 3 hijos de 13, 15 y 18 años de edad, y ha tenido que atravesar por una gran dificultad económica al quedarse desempleada hace unos 4 meses. Trabajaba en una venta de flores y con el salario que le pagaban podía sostener los gastos de su hogar, pero por recorte de personal quedó sin empleo y la situación económica de su hogar se vio gravemente afectada. Desde hace unos 2 meses logró conseguir un poco de capital con el que inició su propio negocio de venta de flores, pero para poder tener un buen negocio requiere de un préstamo para adecuar su sitio de trabajo y comprar surtido de flores para ofrecer a sus clientes.

De esta manera tendrá la posibilidad de ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos permitiendo que su negocio salga adelante y sus ventas aumenten para que los ingresos del hogar también aumenten. Su mayor sueño es tener un buen negocio que le permita brindarles a sus 3 hijos una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Denis is a single mother head of household; she has three children who are 13, 15 and 18 years of age.  She’s gone through severe economic difficulty because she lost her job four months ago.  She was employed selling flowers and her salary was sufficient to cover household expenses but due to cuts in staff she became unemployed and her economic situation at home was gravely affected as a result.  

About two months ago she managed to gather a little capital with which she started her own flower retail business but in order to have a good business she needs a loan to make physical adjustments to her worksite and to buy an assortment of flowers to offer her customers.

In this way she will be able to offer a wider variety of products to her customers allowing her business to move ahead and her sales to increase so that her household income will increase also.  Her greatest dream is to have a business that will allow her to provide her three children with a good quality of life and better economic opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy flowers and make physical improvements to her locale.

loans.name: Diana Yasmin

texts.es:
Diana aprendió desde hace unos 5 años la actividad de la peluquería y desde entonces estaba trabajando en un salón de belleza y con el salario que le pagaban podía contribuir económicamente en su hogar para que su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 1 y 8 años de edad pudieran tener una buena calidad de vida. Pero debido a que necesitaba estar al lado de su hijo de 1 año de nacido tuvo que renunciar a su trabajo y dedicarse a las labores del hogar; sin embargo, como ya no puede contribuir económicamente en su hogar la situación económica se afectado negativamente y esto ha producido grandes dificultades en el hogar. Es por esto que ahora Diana esta buscando montar un salón de belleza en su hogar y como no cuenta con capital busca un préstamo para comprar un tocador, un lavacabezas e implementos de peluquería para montar su propio salón de belleza.

Así podrá estar al cuidado de su hijo menor y también podrá generar ingresos para que en su hogar sigan teniendo una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana learned the beauty salon business about five years ago and since then was employed in a beauty salon earning a salary that she could contribute economically at home so that her husband and two children who are 1 and 8 years old could have a good quality of life.  But, because she needed to care for her 1-year-old son she had to resign from her job and concentrate on household chores.  However, since she could no longer contribute economically to her home, its economic situation was impacted negatively which produced great problems at home.  


Because of this Diana wants to set up a home-based beauty salon but since she lacks capital to do so is looking for a loan to buy a vanity, a hair washing sink and beauty salon tools and equipment to set up her own beauty salon.  In this way she’ll be able to care for her youngest son while still being able to generate income so that they can continue to have a good quality of life at home.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Eves

texts.en:
Eves is 39 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school.  Her husband is a farmer and carpenter.  She and her husband manage two hectares of rice fields. They have been in the farming business for 19 years. Eves also raises hogs and has a fish pond.

Due to increased expenses in her hog raising and fish pond business, Eves is requesting a loan for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizer and insecticides to ensure proper growth of her crops. With the necessary farm inputs, her yields will increase.

Eves is looking forward to increasing her income, which will enable her to supply the basic commodities for her family.  She is determined to educate her four children and give them a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her agricultural business.

loans.name: Gladis De Maria

texts.es:
Gladis cuenta con una experiencia de 15 años en la actividad de la confección, tiene su taller de confección a terceros en su casa desde hace 2 años. Trabaja durante todo el día y con su taller genera 3 empleos para personas con muchas necesidades. Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó desde muy pequeña. La ventaja es que ya tiene reconocimiento en el sector y la producción es muy buena, lo que le ha permitido cada vez conseguir más clientes para su negocio y también se ha transformado en grandes pedidos. Debido a que en la actualidad su capacidad de producción no alcanza para satisfacer a todos sus clientes, Gladis requiere de un préstamo para comprar una máquina plana y una fileteadora para aumentar la capacidad de producción de su negocio.

Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante con su taller de confección y poder tener en su hogar unas mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Gladis has 15 years’ experience in sewing and has had a workshop in her home for the past two years.  She works all day and creates three jobs for people who really need them through her workshop.  She learned this activity from her mother, who taught her when she was very young.  The advantage she has is that she knows the business and her production quality is very good, which has allowed her to increase her number of customers and this has translated into large orders.  Because she doesn’t have the necessary capability to meet all of her customers’ production needs, Gladis need a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine to increase her production capacity.

Her greatest desire is to get ahead with her workshop and be able to have better financial opportunities to move ahead with her husband and three children.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna engages in a vegetable-vending business to help her husband in satisfying their family needs and financing the education of their three children, each of whom they want to earn a degree and become professionals someday. Despite financial difficulty they have the courage to pursue business, for they believe that nothing is impossible for a person who has strong determination.

Edna is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to improve her business. She plans to buy more stocks of bananas, beans, tomatoes, eggplants and cabbages to sell in their community. She hopes that this loan will help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy bananas, beans, tomatoes, eggplants and cabbages to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Nabetangan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, a 53-year-old mother of six, lives in a village where they can raise rice, vegetables and livestock to sell. Due to insufficient income, Rosita is engaged in buying and selling vegetables to generate additional income. She and her husband plan to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn a degree and find a good job someday. They aim to improve their income to cover their necessities and finance their children's education.

Rosita is now requesting a loan of P5,000.00 to buy additional stocks of garlic, bananas, eggplant, bitter melons, beans and ginger to resell in the community. She believes that through this loan, she can improve the business and make it profitable.

loans.use: to buy garlic, bananas, bitter melons, ginger and beans to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Nabetangan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Alejandra Magdalena

texts.es:
Alejandra es una joven emprendedora de 22 años de edad que se dedica a la actividad de la confección y gracias a esto genera ingresos con los cuales puede contribuir con su madre para sostener sus gastos y también ayuda a su pareja para sostener los gastos de su hogar y los gastos de su hijo de 10 meses de nacido. Desde muy temprana edad aprendió la actividad de su madre quien se dedicaba a esta actividad y gracias a esto logró adquirir una gran experiencia para que sus clientes reciban un muy buen trabajo. Con unos ahorros y un gran esfuerzo logró comprar una máquina con la que comenzó a ofrecer el servicio de confección a terceros desde su hogar, y gracias a que ha ido progresando poco a poco ha ido comprando las máquinas necesarias para ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. Debido a que no cuenta con todas las máquinas necesarias para hacer la confección completa de la prenda, debe pagar a un tercero para que realice ciertos procesos de la confección, y esto hace que sus beneficios se reduzcan considerablemente; es por esto que ahora que tiene la oportunidad busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina fileteadora y una máquina recubridora para poder contar con la maquinaria necesaria para poder realizar el proceso completo de la confección de las prendas.

De esta manera sus beneficios aumentarán considerablemente, pues ya no tendrá que pagar altos costos a otra persona para realizar los procesos de confección que no podía hacer en su taller por falta de maquinaria. Su mayor sueño es tener un gran taller de confección y ofrecerle a su hijo de 10 meses de nacido un futuro económico estable y una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a young, 22 year old entrepreneur.  Her business activity is making clothes.  Thanks to this, she generates income with which she is able to contribute, with her mother, to covering their expenses.   She also helps her life partner cover their household expenses and her ten month old son’s expenses.

She learned this business activity from her mother at a very early age.  Her mother devoted herself to this business activity, and thanks to this Alejandra managed to acquire great experience so that her customers receive very good work.

With some savings and great effort she managed to buy a machine with which she started to offer, from home, her sewing services to third parties. Thanks to the fact that it has been progressing little by little, she has been buying the machines needed to offer her customers good service.

Due to the fact that she does not have all of the machines needed to finish sewing the garments, she needs to pay a third party to do some sewing processes.  This reduces her profits considerably.   That is why she now looks to a loan to buy an overlock machine and an upholstery machine in order to be able to have the machinery she needs to be able complete the process of making the clothes.

Her profits will increase considerably this way.  She will not have to pay high costs to another person to do the sewing process that she could not do in her shop due to lack of machinery.  Her biggest dream is to have a large sewing shop and to provide her ten month old son with a stable financial future and a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine and an upholstery machine.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una joven madre soltera cabeza de hogar de sus 2 hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad, y es una emprendedora que ha tomado el negocio de tradición familiar y lo ha hecho crecer en gran medida. Su madre comenzó el negocio de la venta de cerdos con un cerdo que le regalaron y desde allí comenzó el negocio con el que sacó adelante a Ana. Ahora que tiene la responsabilidad, Ana ha hecho un gran esfuerzo por sacar su negocio adelante y así generar ingresos para que su madre pueda tener una buena calidad de vida, y también para sostener sus 2 hijos brindándoles un buen hogar. Debido a que sus pedidos aumentaron considerablemente, Ana decidió comenzar a construir un nuevo corral para los cerdos y los pollos de cría, pues ya no caben en donde normalmente los criaba, pero debido a que no cuenta con mucho capital Ana busca un préstamo para terminar de construir los nuevos corrales para los cerdos y los pollos donde puedan caber todos sus animales. 

Así podrá responder a los pedidos de sus clientes y tendrá la oportunidad de generar mejores ingresos para su hogar y brindarles a sus 2 hijos unas mejores condiciones de vida y el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Ana is a young single mother head of household; she has two children who are 7 and 10 years old.  She’s an entrepreneur who has taken up the business that’s a family tradition and has made it grow quite a bit.  Her mother started the business of selling pigs with just a single pig someone gave her and from there the business got going and she was able to support Ana with it.  Now that Ana is responsible for it, she’s making a big effort to move it forward to generate income so that her mother can have a good quality of life and also to support her own two children providing them with a good home.

Because her orders have increased considerably, Ana decided to start building new corrals for the pigs and chicks she raises because they don’t fit any longer in the ones she normally uses but because Ana does not have much capital she needs a loan to finish building the new corrals where all the pigs and the chicks can fit.  In this way she will be able to respond to customer demand and will be able to generate improved income for her home and to provide her two children with better living conditions as well as access to a better quality education.

loans.use: to finish building corrals.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en: Armida is 32 years old, married, and has two school-age children. They live happily in a village, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Due to insufficient income, Armida runs a small variety store to generate additional income. She aimed to improve and strengthen her store to increase her income. Due to financial difficulty, she is asking for additional capital of 5,000 PHP to buy inventory of soft drinks, snack foods, candies, canned goods, beverages, and seasonings. She is hoping that someday her business will grow and become a viable of source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snack foods, candies, canned goods, beverages, and seasonings

location.town: Brgy. Nabetangan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a mother who strives to improve their poor living conditions in order to give their children a bright future. Despite the hardship of living, they have the determination to work out their plans and achieve their goals in the future.

Crisanta runs a small variety store in the village to generate additional income. Due to insufficient capital, she is requesting a loan of P5,000.00 to buy additional stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, breads, soap bars, shampoos, and beverages for sale. She believes that the loan will help her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additonal stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, breads, soap bars, shampoos, and beverages to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Nabetangan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Maria Oliva

texts.es:
Maria es una persona muy trabajadora que siendo una madre soltera cabeza de hogar ha sacado adelante a sus 2 hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad. Desde que su ex esposo los abandonó del hogar, se dejaron de recibir ingresos en su casa, por esto para poder sostener a sus hijos y brindarles una buena calidad de vida se vio obligada a salir a buscarse el sustento en diferentes actividades. Un día logró con unos ahorros montar su propio almacén donde ofrece productos de uso personal y con mucho esfuerzo lo fue sacando adelante poco a poco; ahora gracias a este negocio sus hijos pueden acceder a una educación de buena calidad y espera que en un futuro pueda brindarles una educación universitaria. Debido a que no cuenta con un capital que le permita comprar productos que requiere en su negocio, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar celulares y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes.

Así podrá tener a sus clientes satisfechos y seguir generando los ingresos para el hogar y tener una buena calidad de vida. Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia para brindarles a sus 2 hijos un hogar más estable.
texts.en:
María is a very hardworking person who being a single mother head of household has moved her two children who are 18 and 16 years of age ahead.  When her ex-husband abandoned the home household income ceased to be produced.  In order for her to support her children and provide them with a good quality of life she had to find a way to generate income through various activities.

On day she managed to use some savings she had to open a store of her own where she offers personal use items.  With much effort she gradually moved it forward.  Now, thanks to this business her children are able to access a better quality education and she hopes in the future to be able to provide them with a university education as well.  

Because she does not have capital to buy products needed in her store, María needs a loan to buy mobile phones to meet customer demand.   In this way she will satisfy customers and continue generating income for the home and have a good quality of life.  Her greatest dream is to have a house of her own to provide her two children with a more stable home.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa est mariée à un chauffeur, elle est âgée de 38ans et de profession revendeuse. C’est en 2006, qu’elle a débuté cette activité de vente d’assiettes et de sceaux et le fait seule dans une boutique. Elle achète les marchandises chez les grossistes au Grand marché de Lomé. Son second crédit qu’elle demande lui servira à acheter de nouveaux modèles d’assiettes et de sceaux. Madame Adjowa veut augmenter son stock et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjowa is married to a driver.  She is 38 years old and works as a reseller.

It is in 2006 that she started to sell plates and buckets, and she works alone in a shop.

She buys her goods from wholesalers at the Grand Market in Lomé.

This second loan will be used to buy new models of plates and buckets.

Adjowa wants to increase her stock and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy plates and buckets.

loans.name: Merjorie

texts.en:
Merjorie is a hardworking spouse and mother to her two children. They live in the small village of Buneg. She always makes it a point to spend time with her family and make every moment worthwhile for them.

For over the past twenty years Merjorie and her husband have raised rice and corn. The couple’s main goal is to increase their income so as to be able to provide their children with a quality education and a better standard of living. She is really thankful because on her children’s days off they help out on the farm so as to minimize farming expenses.

Merjorie wants to improve her rice crop production. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI because of an abrupt increase in the price of fertilizer and insecticides. If she can keep her farm thriving, she will be able to increase her profits and so meet her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides to improve her rice crop production.

loans.name: Kokoé

texts.fr: Femme d’un plombier, et mère de 02 enfants âgés de 36 et 28ans qui ne sont plus sur les bancs de l’école, Madame Kokoé âgée de 56ans est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale (riz, huile végétale, riz…) et des condiments (tomates, piments, oignons épices…) dans une boutique.  Deux personnes l’aident dans l’exercice de ses taches et elle sollicite un troisième prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle veut avec les profits, réinvestir une partie dans l’activité et l’autre partie à l’épargne. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait devenir grossiste dans la vente des céréales et assurer le bien –être de la famille.
texts.en:
Kokoé is married to a plumber and the mother of two children, ages 36 and 28 years old, who no longer attend school.  

She is 56 years old and works in a shop as a reseller of general food products (rice, vegetable oil...) and condiments (tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, spices...). Two persons help her to carry out her tasks.

Kokoé is requesting a third loan in order to buy some merchandise.

She wants to reinvest part of the profits in the business and save the rest.

In the coming years, she would like to become a grain wholesaler and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy condiments and general food products.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy has been operating her sari-sari, or small variety store for almost five years. She aims to improve it to supplement her husband’s income to cover their family’s needs. She usually earns 8000 PHP in profits a month, usually spending it on the family’s food and clothing and allowances for their children.

Precy is applying for a 5000 PHP loan from ASKI to increase her store’s offerings and satisfy her customers’ demands. She will buy fish balls, hot dogs, spaghetti, canned goods, noodles, beverages, snack foods and soap to sell. She believes that this loan will make it possible for her to improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

location.town: Brgy. Nabetangan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Albazin

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos 3 dos quais 3 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É assistente técnico numa Instituição do Estado. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar mercadoria (óleo, feijão, arroz, farinha, sabão e outros) para reiniciar a sua actividade comercial.
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida e a constante subida dos preços no mercado grossista.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married father of four children, three of whom attend school.He lives in his own home along with his family, and does not support anyone else. He intends to use this loan to buy stock (cooking oil, beans, rice, flour, soap-berry and other items) to restart his business.
In the future he hopes to finish building his home and improve his family's living conditions. Consequently, he promises to repay his loan in full so that he can apply to Hluvuku again.
The biggest challenge that he faces is the increasing cost of living and the ever-rising prices of buying wholesale stock.

loans.use: to buy and sell produce (cooking oil, beans, rice, flour, soap-berry and other items).

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha is 40 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs a taxi (Tuk Tuk) service. He earns about $8 each day. One of her children runs the Tuk Tuk taxi as well when he is free from his study. He earns about $4 per day. 

Pha is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. In addition, part of this money will be used for raising fish. This money will help Pha provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: rebuild her house

loans.name: Thongny

texts.en: Thongny, 33, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. She has been selling clothes in Phnom Penh city since 2010, and is able to make about US$8 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, making approximately US$18 in revenue a day. This couple has two school-aged children. Seang Thongny would like to take out a loan of US$1500 to purchase land as an investment. This land will sell for a profit when the price goes up.

loans.use: to purchase land as an investment.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, 38, lives with her husband and four children in Siem Reap province. Since 2004, she has been working in a state hospital in Siem Reap, making approximately US$5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver. He has been driving a motor-taxi since 2000, and is able to make US$6 a day. He earns the most during the dry season.  Dry season is the season that has a lot of tourists come to visit Angkor Wat Temple. This couple also gets support from one child who is a construction worker building houses. 

Chan has a plan to raise chickens, so she would like to ask for a loan of US$1200 to purchase wood to build chicken cages. She believes that this new business will bring her more income to support her small family.

loans.use: buy wood to build chicken cages

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn, 47, is a widowed farmer who lives with one of her daughters in Siem Reap province.  She typically makes about US$3 each day and her daughter, Pum Pisey, makes about US$4 each as a staff at a local private company in Siem Reap town. Sorn would like to ask for a loan of US$500 to rebuild some parts of her house which was damaged.

loans.use: rebuild her damaged house

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a woman with strong determination and believes in herself. She is now 61 years of age but yet very energetic.  She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She needs to be strong in finding a source of income because her husband already left her. She has three children but they have already their own family and she doesn’t want to depend on them. So, Milagros is carefully managing her business. 

Milagros wants to boost her income in order for her to save funds for herself.  She is requesting PHP 25,000 to purchase rice, biscuits, breads, soft drinks, and canned goods to sell. She is hoping that these goods will provide her with more income.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a hard working mother who supports her husband in managing their rice farming business to ensure a high yield. She is 45 years old and has  two school-aged children. As a responsible parent, they aim to educate their children and give them a bright future. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Shirley and her husband need to increase their income to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their children. For this reason, they plan to expand their rice plantation to increase their production, but they have inadequate capital.  Shirley is asking for an additional of P25,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in transplanting rice seedlings. They believe that through patience and hard work, they will improve their farming business and achieve their goals in the future.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seedlings

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar está casado, tiene 28 años de edad, tiene una hija nena, es maestro de educación física, se dedica a impartir enseñanza sobre curso de deportes y también es arbitro en las diferentes ramas deportivas, tiene 3 años de experiencia en esta profesión. 

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de insumos para la venta de comida y bebidas, ya que debido a la necesidad que tiene de tener otro poco de ingreso y mejorar su condición de vida, va a comprar verduras, condimentos, carnes, leche, chocolate, etc. Espera en el futuro darle lo mejor a su hija, y en si a su familia.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is married, is 28 years old, and has a baby daughter. He is a physical education teacher who teaches all types of sports and is also a referee for a variety of sporting events. He has three years of experience in this profession.

He is requesting a loan that will serve to buy supplies to sell food and drinks. Due to his need for another little more income and to improve his living conditions, he will buy vegetables, condiments, meat, milk, chocolate, etc. 

In the future, he hopes to provide the best for his daughter and his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sell snacks

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros, 37, has been selling souvenirs in Siem Reap town since 2002 and is able to make about US$10 per day. She is a widow with three young school-aged children. Currently, she lives with her younger sister, Ryai, who works at the souvenir shop.  

Ros would like to take out a loan of US$1500 to purchase more souvenirs to sell and the leftover money will be used to rebuild her house.

loans.use: buy souvenirs to sell

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, 38, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhang province. She is a construction worker making US$ 2.70 per day.  Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who also works as a construction foreman. He typically makes US$6 per day.  

Sothea would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to replace an old and unreliable motorbike and purchase more construction materials for her husband's work.

loans.use: buy a motorbike and construction materials

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Dany, 40, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Siem Reap province. Currently, she stays at home doing house work and cooks for her family members. Her husband is a construction foreman making US$10 per day.

Dany would like to take out for a loan of US$1000 to hire a a tractor to plow her farm land and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: pay to plow her farm and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Senghun

texts.en:
Senghun, 51, is married and lives with two of her children in Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband work together in making and selling traditional cakes in the market. Together they make around US$5 each day.  Their family is also supported by one of the children, who is a construction worker.

Senghun would like to ask for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a car so that she can transport and distribute cakes to her big buyers.

loans.use: buy a car for her cake business

loans.name: Agabagaya Kyakaki Group

texts.en:
Robina is 32 years old.  She is married and has four children.  She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a farmer, and, with the income earned, she has been able to buy land and expand her farming activities.  Unpredictable seasonal weather and price fluctuation are the main challenges she is facing.  Her dream is to educate her children, build a permanent home and hire employees to help expand her business.
She is a member of the above mentioned group where members guarantee each other in order to access a loan.  Robina wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en: Sokhan is 45 years old, married and blessed with two children. She resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a chef for more than four years, earning about $4 per day. Her husband is a security guard who earns about $4 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sokhan is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. In the future, she would like to run a food store and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea is 27 years old, married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating agricultural crops and fattening up cattle for more than 10 years, earning approximately $1 per day. Her husband sells sugarcane juice, earning about $6 daily. Sophea is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a juice-squeezing machine to use in her husband's business. This money will help him generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a juice-sqeezing machine to use in her husband's beverage business.

loans.name: Aem

texts.en:
Aem, 42, is married with three young children living at home in Battambong province. She and her husband work in construction and typically make US$5 each daily. This small family also gets support from one of their children, who is a construction worker as well. 

Aem would like to take out a loan of US$1100 to purchase a motorbike for her small family’s transportation. This new motorbike will reduce transportation cost and save her some money to spend in the future.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Davann

texts.en: Davann is 37 years old, married and lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a hospital for more than five years, earning approximately $5 each day. Her husband is a security guard who earns about $3 daily. Davann is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm to earn more income to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house.

loans.name: No

texts.en: No is 32 years old, married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1998, earning about $4 per day. Her husband runs a business buying and selling cattle. He earns about $5 each day. All of their children are students. Each month, she spends $45 on food, $5 on utility expenses and $21 on other expense. No is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more cattle for trading. This money will help her make more income for her family to attain a good living standard. In the future, she would like to expand her business, decorate her house and help her children get a higher education.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for trading.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 29 years old.  She is married and is charged with the responsibility of looking after her four children.  Her husband gave her capital to start up the business.   Her major challenge is customers not paying on time, which hinders her business. Her dream is to build a permanent home and move her business to a more permanent location.  Christine needs the loan to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina wants a loan to buy charcoal to sell.  She is aged 45 and is married.  She has two children, and she lives in Masindi, Uganda. She has been selling charcoal for eight years.  She used her personal savings to start her business.  Her major challenge is customers not paying on time.  She has goals of educating her children, building a permanent home, and moving the business to more permanent location.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bena

texts.en: Bena is a widow, aged 55, who is living in Masindi, Uganda.  She deals in a produce business which she has operated for 30 years. With the proceeds, she has been able to buy land and pay school fees for her children, who are now graduates. She has challenges of high fuel and transportation costs, as well as theft.  Her dream is to operate a food store.  Bena wants a loan to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Marié à une revendeuse, père de 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés, Mr Koffi soucieux de l’avenir de sa famille a commencé par vendre depuis 2010 de la boisson. Son activité se fait dans un bar et ses clients ne cessent de s’accroitre de jour en jour en cette période de vacances. Pour mieux les satisfaire, il sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour s’approvisionner en boissons, en tables et chaises.  Il veut dans l’avenir, transformer le bar en maquis et assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants. Notons que ses enfants sont âgés de 12, 09,07 et 02ans. Son approvisionnement se fait au marché chez les grossistes.
texts.en:
Married to a retailer and the father of four children, three of whom are in school, Koffi, concerned about the future of his family, began selling drinks in 2010.  His business is carried out in a bar, and his customers are increasing day by day during the vacation season. 

To ensure more customer satisfaction, Koffi has requested an initial loan from WAGES to stock up on drinks, tables and chairs. In the future he wants to transform the bar into an eatery and ensure a better future for his children, aged 12, 9, 7 and 2 years old.  His supplies are bought from wholesalers at the market.

loans.use: To buy drinks, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es: Thamy de 32 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen de ella. Lleva 4 años como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de lentes y cosméticos desde hace 3 años aproximadamente. Comenzó con la idea de incrementar sus ingresos y así también mejorar su calidad de vida. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa y ha podido dar educación a sus 2 pequeños hijos. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir todos los gastos de casa, ya que es la única persona que solventa su hogar. Su plan para el futuro es comprarse un auto para que distribuya sus productos. Thamy usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio, ya que en estas fechas sus ventas tienden a incrementarse por las celebraciones de Fiestas Patrias. Ella pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Mujeres Empresarias”, el cual está conformado por 10 personas  y lleva el cargo de presienta desde hace 4 meses.
texts.en:
Thamy is 32 years old, single and has two children who depend on her. She has been a client of Edaprospo for four years, and she has been selling glasses and cosmetics for approximately three years.  

She started with the idea of increasing her income and, at the same time, improving her quality of life. With her effort and work she managed to build her home and she has been able to educate her two young children. Currently, she uses her income to cover all the household expenses, since she is the only person supporting her home. Her plan for the future is to buy a car to distribute her products. 

Thamy used the loan to buy merchandise for her business, because at this time her sales tend to increase because of the National Holidays. She belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Empresarias", which consists of ten people and she has held the position of president for four months.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lino

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É docente e quadro do Ministério da Educação há bastante tempo e também tem um negócio próprio de criação e venda de frangos de corte. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, vacinas, ração e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade dos frangos para conseguir responder a demanda.
No futuro deseja aumentar a capacidade do seu negócio e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida e a constante subida dos preços.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married father of two children, who both attend school. He lives in his own home with his family and does not support anyone else.
He has been a teacher and a member of staff at the Ministry of Education for quite some time, and he also runs his own business raising and selling broiler chickens. He intends to use this loan to buy chicks, vaccines, feed and vitamins in order to increase the size of his flock so that he can fulfill his orders.
In the future he hopes to increase the size of his business and improve his family's standard of living. Consequently, he promises to repay his loan in full so that he can apply to Hluvuku again.
The biggest challenges he faces are the high cost of living and the ever-increasing prices.

loans.use: to buy chicks, vaccines, feed, and vitamins in order to increase the size of his flock so that he can fulfill his orders.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 36 years old.  He is married and has five children.  He is living in Hioma, Uganda. He is a farmer and has been in the agricultural sector for a long time.  He grows maize and rice for sale.  He faces the challengesof inadequate capital to purchase the necessary inputs.  He wishes to build a permanent house for his family, expand his business to new markets, and hire employees to help expand his farming activities. Moses intends to use the loan to buy maize and rice for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize and rice for planting.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred requested a loan to buy cassavas to sell.  She is a thirty-two-year-old married woman with six children living in Masindi, Uganda.  She sells food and charcoal, and got the start up capital from her husband.  Customers not paying on time hinders her business.  She desires to build a permanent home and buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: buy cassavas to sell

loans.name: Pek

texts.en:
Pek is 24 years old. She is married and blessed with one child.  They live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.  Pek is a homemaker. Her husband is employed in a hotel and earns about $5 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Pek is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce the expenses of transportation. In the future, she would like to run a clothes shop and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Soch

texts.en:
Soch is 54 years old. She is married and blessed with two children.  They live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Soch has been involved in growing rice and worked as a cleaner for more than seven years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $8 daily. 

Soch is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase seeds and fertilizer to use for cultivating rice. In the future, she would like to run a business producing concrete chairs and tables to sell and to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sineat

texts.en: Sineat is 49 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than four years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in cultivating rice and rubber plants to sell, and earns about $16 daily. Two of her children are employed as rubber plant workers and earn about $10 each day. Sineat is requesting a loan of $1000 to pay for the expenses of hiring laborers to cultivate the rubber plants. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more convenient for the family.

loans.use: to pay for the expenses of hiring laborers to cultivate the rubber plants

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en: Sulaiman wants a loan to buy produce such as groundnuts and maize to sell.  He is aged 45 and is married.  He has two children and he lives in Masindi –Uganda.  He buys cereal grains, grinds them, then sells at a marginal profit.  He has been in business for four years.  His dream is to educate his children and diversify the business, despite challenges in price fluctuation and inflation.

loans.use: to buy produce, such as groundnuts and maize, to sell.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea is 41 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up pigs for more than ten years, earning approximately $7 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $8 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Kunthea is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase more farmland to use for cultivating agricultural crops. This money will help her expand her business and earn more money to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: buy farmland to grow crops

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom is 57 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children (a daughter and a son) in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her daughter is employed in a restaurant and earns $4 daily. Her son is a construction worker who earns about $4 each day. 

Yom is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family.  In the future, she would like to run an additional business in order to make more money to financially support her family.

loans.use: buy timber to build a new house

loans.name: Mab

texts.en:
Mab is 44 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up cattle for more than four years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 per day. 

Mab is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase bricks and cement to use for constructing her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a small pig farm and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: buy materials to build her house

loans.name: Manuel Jose

texts.es:
Manuel tiene un almacén donde vende toda clase de productos a sus clientes como juguetería, productos de uso personal, productos de decoración para el hogar y otros más, el cual es su fuente de ingresos y la fuente de ingresos para su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, y es gracias a este negocio que han logrado salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades y también ha podido brindarles a sus hijos el acceso a una educación de buena calidad. Hace un tiempo cuando inició su negocio comenzó ofreciendo una cantidad muy reducida de mercancía, y debido a esto sus ventas eran muy esporádicas dado que sus clientes no tenían confianza de comprar en su negocio; sin embargo, gracias a la buena atención que siempre ha caracterizado su negocio logró hacerse conocer de muchas personas y así poco a poco salir adelante con su almacén. La ventaja que siempre ha tenido es que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy amable y generoso, y esto le ha permitido conocer a muchas personas de su municipio y por tanto hacer que los clientes de su negocio aumenten considerablemente. En los próximos meses uno de sus hijos comenzará la educación universitaria, y debido a los altos costos que esto trae consigo, Manuel debe aumentar sus ventas para poder contar con el dinero suficiente para sostener sus gastos universitarios; es por esto que ahora busca un préstamo para comprar artículos de uso personal y juguetería que ahora no tiene la oportunidad de ofrecer en su almacén y así ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes para que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente.

De esta manera logrará tener mayores ventas y así unos ingresos con los que podrá sostener los gastos universitarios de su hijo mayor. Además, seguirá teniendo satisfechos a sus clientes y esto le permitirá seguir creciendo para que en su hogar sigan contando con los ingresos que les permite tener una buena calidad de vida y muy buenas oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Manuel has a store where he sells all sorts of products to his customers, such as toys, personal products, decorative items for the home, and other products.  This business is his source of income and the source of income for his home, where he lives with his wife and their 2 children.  Thanks to this business, he has managed to get ahead in spite of the adversity he has faced, and he has also been able to provide his children with access to a good quality education.  

Some time ago, when he started his business, he was offering a very small quantity of merchandise for sale and so his sales were sporadic as his customers did not have confidence in buying from his shop.  However, thanks to the good service he provides in his business, he has managed to make himself known to a lot of people and so has gradually made progress with his business.  One advantage that he has always had is that he is known to be a very friendly and generous person.  This has allowed him to get to know a lot of people in his town, and as a result the clientele of his business has increased a lot.  

In the coming months, one of his sons will start at the university, and since this brings considerable costs Manuel must increase his sales so that he will have enough money to pay the university fees.  For this reason, he is seeking a loan to buy personal products and toys that up until now he has not had the opportunity to sell in his store.  This way, he will have a greater variety of products for his customers so that he can increase his sales.  

In this manner, he will achieve greater sales and so will have more income that he can use to support his oldest son's university studies.  Also, he will continue to have satisfied customers, which will help him to grow the business so that he can continue to rely on income that will support a good quality of life and good opportunities for economic progress.

loans.use: to buy personal products and toys to sell

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy is 29 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is employed in a pig farm and earns about $4 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Chanthy is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase insecticide, fertilizer and seeds to use in cultivating vegetables. This money will help her run additional business and earn more money to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to breed pigs and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase insecticide, fertilizer and seeds to use in cultivating vegetables

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes depuis 1994, Mme Akouvi est mère de 02 enfants tous à l’école. L’ainé a 18 et le dernier 13ans. Son conjoint est électricien et son  activité se déroule dans un marché de la place lieu ou elle s’approvisionne également. Elle est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et est à son troisième crédit. Avec cet argent, elle aura le temps de s’approvisionner en pagnes. Elle veut augmenter son stock, maintenir son activité et répondre à toutes demandes de nouveauté.
texts.en: Mrs. Akouvi has been selling traditional colorful “pagnes” fabric since 1994. She has two children, both in school. The oldest is 18 years old, and the youngest is 13. Her husband is an electrician working a the local market where she also stocks up. She is a long-time WAGES client, now  on her third loan. She will use these funds to stock up on “pagnes” fabric. She would like to expand her stock, bolster her business and respond to customer demand for  new selection of goods.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric.

loans.name: Phors

texts.en: Phors is 40 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are sculptors who earn about $10 each day. Her son helps her run the business. Her daughter runs a food store. She earns about $3 daily. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Phors is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. In addition, a part of this money is used to buy the tree trunks to use for sculpting. This money will help her expand her business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Nara

texts.en: Nara is 43 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $5 each day. Her son is a driver who earns about $7 per day. Nara is requesting a loan of $700 to buy a house to provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an agricultural business and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a house to provide better living conditions for her family

loans.name: Sinang

texts.en: Sinang is 56 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling noodles and pancakes for more than ten years, earning approximately $15 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 daily. Her son is employed in a pure drinking water factory and earns about $3 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sinang is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase groceries to resell. This money will help her acquire the security to start the new business and earn more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell

loans.name: Sok Yoeurn

texts.en: Sok Yoeurn is 31 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 each day. She has been working ina  garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sok Yoeurn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a sewing shop and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Alikul

texts.ru: Аликул проживает в Яванском районе. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Аликул уже четыре года как занимается растениеводством. В основном Аликул выращивает овощи. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Alikul lives in the Yavan district.  He is 53 years old, married and has four children.  Alikul has been involved in agriculture for four years.  He primarily grows vegetables.  He is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 33-year-old married man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda.

For 5 years, Joel has been operating a retail shop and also farming. With the proceeds from these businesses, he has been able to buy more land and pay school fees for his children.

Inadequate capital to purchase stock is his challenge, because the demand for the goods is very high. He desires to educate his children and expand his business into new markets. Joel needs the loan facility to buy general merchandise, such as soap and sugar, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as soap and sugar, to sell.

loans.name: Latifi

texts.ru:
Латифи проживает в районе Яван. Он родился 1966 году. Латифи добропорядочный гражданин Таджикистана. Он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
Латифи живет с женой. У него семеро детей.
texts.en: Latifi lives in the Yavan district.  He was born in 1966.  Latifi is a conscientious citizen of Tajikistan.  He is involved in animal husbandry and breeds cattle for subsequent sale.  He has been in this business for four years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase calves.  Latifi lives with his wife, and they have seven children.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Sarvarbi

texts.ru:
Сарварби жительница Яванского района. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Сын Сарварби работает на заводе. Сама Сарварби имеет среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей более пяти лет. Сарварби у себя дома открыла торговую точку, где продает одежду, материалы и ткани. 
Сарварби просит кредит для покупки школьных принадлежностей и школьной формы с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Sarvarbi is a resident of the Yavan district.  She is 41 years old, married and has five children.  Sarvarbi's son works at a factory.  Sarvarbi has a secondary education.  She has been involved in sales for over five years.  Sarvarbi opened a retail outlet at home, where she sells clothing, supplies and fabrics.  Sarvarbi is requesting this loan to purchase school supplies and uniforms in order to expand the merchandise selection.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and uniforms

loans.name: Avazoy

texts.ru: Авазой жительница района Яван. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У нее 9 детей. Авазой занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. В этой области Авазой имеет хороший опыт. Животноводством она занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Avazoy is a resident of the Yavan district.  She is 51 years old, married and has nine children.  Avazoy is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds cattle at home.  Avazoy has good experience in this business.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for six years.  She is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Khayrulo

texts.ru:
Хайруло проживает в районе Фархор. Ему 62 года. У него большая семья. Он женат, имеет шестерых детей. Еще у него имеются славные внуки. 
Хайруло более 22 лет занимается растениеводством. Он при доме имеет не большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи и зернобобовые культуры. Хайрулло просит кредит для повторного посева овощей.
texts.en: Khayrulo lives in the Farkhor district.  He is 62 years old and has a large family.  He is married and has six children.  He also has great grandchildren.  Khayrulo has been involved in agriculture for 22 years.  He has a small plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables and legumes.  Khayrulo is requesting this loan for a repeat sowing of vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y querer brindar una buena calidad de vida a su esposa y su hija de 5 años de edad, y gracias a esto ha logrado superar grandes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida. Anteriormente trabajaba en una fábrica de arepas y allí devengaba un salario el cual no era suficiente para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, por esto decidió iniciar con un cultivo de frutas y así comenzó a mejor su situación económica; pero este negocio se vino abajo cuando tuvo que dar por pérdida total su cultivo debido a los daños causados por las inundaciones del invierno, y fue así como decidió regresar a la actividad de la fabricación de arepas pero montando su propio negocio y también generando empleo. Desde hace 2 años que tiene su propia fábrica de arepas la calidad de vida y las condiciones económicas de su familia han mejorado considerablemente, y además de esto puede mejorar la calidad de vida de 4 personas que les puede brindar trabajo en su fábrica. Debido a que su negocio fue montado con muy bajo capital, aún tiene algunos requerimientos para poder realizar su producción con mejores procesos, por esto busca un préstamo que le permita comprar un horno a gas, dos ollas grandes y materias primas para mejorar sus procesos de producción de arepas.

De esta manera podrá satisfacer toda la demanda por su producto y así podrá tener unos mejores ingresos para su familia. Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y poder tener mejores oportunidades económicas y mejor calidad de vida en su hogar, además de seguir generando empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Ernesto is a person who has always been known for being very hard-working, and for wanting to provide a good quality of life for his wife and his 5-year-old daughter. Thanks to this, he has been able to overcome great adversities which life has presented to him. Previously, he worked in an arepa factory, and there he received a salary which was not sufficient to cover his household expenses. For this reason he decided to start growing fruit, and he started to improve his economic situation. However, this business went downhill when his crop became a total loss due to damages caused by winter floods. Thus he decided to return to the work of making arepas, but this time by starting his own business and also generating jobs. For the past 2 years, he has operated his own arepa factory, and his family's quality of life and economic conditions have improved considerably. In addition, he has been able to improve the quality of life of 4 people for whom he provides work in his factory. Since his business was set up with very little capital, he still has some needs so that he can carry out his production with better processes. For this reason he is seeking a loan which will allow him to buy a gas stove, two large pans and raw materials to improve his arepa production processes. 

In this way, he will be able to satisfy all of the demand for his product, and thus he will have better income for his family. His greatest dream is to get ahead with his business and have better economic opportunities and a better quality of life in his home, in addition to generating employment for people who need it most.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove, two large pans and raw materials to improve his production process for arepas [traditional corn breads].

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 57-year-old married man with 10 children living in Masindi, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests on him and his dream is to see all his children educated.

John is both a shopkeeper and fish monger, and has been in these business for 20 years. Price fluctuations and inflation are his major challenges; however, his dreams are to diversify the business to include farming, to expand his business, and to build a permanent house for residence.

John intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise, such as salt and cooking oil, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as salt and cooking oil, to sell.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is 31 years old. He is married and resides with his three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a soldier who earns about $3 daily. His wife is a homemaker. 

In order to improve his family’s finances, Seda is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase stocks of fish and poultry to breed in order to sell when they gain weight. This money will help him run an additional business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fish and poultry to breed in order to sell when they gain weight
